Then the server comes to take my order and I am salivating. They are completely out of the Buffalo burger! Damn it!  Oh okay, I try to be pacified by the wilted fries that just got placed in front of me. 

Also, why do they have a Harvard flag hanging up with its eclectic, junky decor? This is Badger country, people! The only red and white that should show up is University of Wisconsin-Madison's!

Also, if they are going to be playing old, classic, or just plain quirky films, and not put the sound on, why not put up closed captioning?!? So when patrons look up, they have something to read while waiting and waiting and waiting for their food? 

Then Dotties has t-shirts available, but who is going to be interested in wearing them with fat babies with bibs plastered on them? Jeez! They have to potential to make them so much better, and then get free advertising from college students running around wearing them.

Second time I've been here and each time has been equally delicious. I see some reviews indicating poor service, but ours was great! 

Burgers are phenomenal. You can tell the beef is really great quality and that the cooks know what they are doing. Fries are great too, make sure to get the English Garlic sauce to dip them in. I indulged in a chocolate milkshake as well, which was perfectly thick and chocolately. The atmosphere is also very cozy and inviting.

I had their new Bayou Burger. Only complaint would be that it was quite hard to get the cajun flavor described on the menu through the burger. I couldn't find the "Louisiana Hot Sauce" anywhere on my burger. However the Cajun Mayo was very good, and I appreciate that it came on the side so you could decide how much or how little you wanted. Also, they should really invest in some gluten-free buns! Being gluten-free, I would definitely gravitate towards the Nitty Gritty or DLUX instead of Dotty's, simply for the gluten-free buns those places offer.

Overall, a great place to grab a bite!
Good burgers, adorable menu, cute place. Don't even try to go there when there is an event at the Kohl Center though. It will not work.

I was in town for dinner and wanted a good burger, this place came highly recommended on Yelp. I ordered their cheese curds and yes they are fantastic yet for four people you probably want two orders I mean we got less than 15 total cheese curds and they come in a giant basket.  I ordered the burger their menu said was the best seller it had their homemade garlic sauce which was delicious and the burger was cooked perfectly. I also had fries and those there were a ton of which was a nice change. The service was fantastic my drink was never empty which I always appreciate. Overall it was a good place to get a burger with great prices.

Awesome place to go before a Badgers hoops game! Great beer selection and some of the best burgers I have had in my life! There are about 15 types of burgers on the menu so plenty to choose from. Also, very good service. We got seated at about 11:15 before a noon game and we were able to get our food, drinks and bill in time to make the start of the game.

I was seated in a corner booth facing all together four booths, filled with college students in happy conversations around their tumblers of soda. This was a neat place, a bit dark in a moody kind of way, but nice in the way that you can still see your food an your companions kind of way.
The service was great, a friendly waitress with a flower in her hair, big gleaming eyes and a biggest smile I have ever seen of someone recommending a local beer. She got me Hopalicious and it was delicious. An of course for the burger, I went for their famous The Melting Pot, and it was glorious. The best burger I have ever had. Really. 
I just wish that I have known of this place three days earlier. Well, next time in Madison..

There's no better place in Madison for perfectly-done, sloppy hamburgers. The sheer variety of toppings is amazing (guacamole, English garlic sauce, etc., but no fried egg??). Atmosphere is distinctive, noisy (in a good way), super casual. I love the fact that although it's a "sporty" venue, being so close to the Kohl Center, they play Turner Classic Movies on the TVs! Tip: if dining with at least one other, it's cheaper to split the deluxe fries. Oh, and you have to have mayo on the side (for true "Euro-fries", pour the mayo over the fries).

The first thing about this place - it's dark. I always walk by thinking it's closed. Second thing - the burgers don't come automatically with sides, so you need to remember to order fries or cheese curds or whatever.

I love the fried mushrooms. Cheese curds are quite good too. The rest of the sides are just so-so - I do not recommend the sampler.

I do like the burgers - and the fun names make it even better. The first time I came, I just got a normal cheeseburger - not exciting. Second time, I got the basil mozzarella - delicious and my favorite. The Melting Pot is also sooo good, but a little too heavy for me most of the time.

Service: always friendly, good with recommendations
Environment: typical bar/restaurant, usually sports on TV, booth seats. It's got a cozy feel that I like though.

I am going here tomorrow and I can't wait! Dotty's has the best cheese curds in Madison. Just thinking about them is making my mouth water.  

I love that you can get Buffalo or Ostritch burgers here, and there are numerous choices for toppings.

The wait before a hockey game can be redic, but if you get there early enough its not too big of a deal, but it will still be crowded as hell and inevitably you will have someone standing over you waiting for a table. On game days they aren't very good at estimating the wait, so beware, 30 minutes could possibly really be an hour and a half. If you have the time, the food is so worth it.

I actually give it 3.5 stars! We got two burgers: the California and the Stanley. I felt like the Stanley was delicious but way too much bbq sauce. However the California didn't have enough toppings. There was only a thin layer of guac and barely any sprouts. The cheese curds were delicious though! Yum!

Warning: fries are NOT included in your burger decision.

Great burgers, good service but a little pricy if you want any side other than french fries.  In other words you can not upgrade to sweet potato fries they make you order both which is kind of ridiculous.  So you end up with a burger, regular fries and sweet potato fries with a soft drink is about $20.  But zero complaints about the way the food tastes.

DOTTY'S DUMPLING DOWRY...YASSSS!!!!!

Okay, let me air my two minor grievances immediately as others have also stated:  Service can be dodgey on weekend nights and Badger game days/evenings. You're asking for it if you show up during these times. But it IS worth it!!! Also, you have to order burgers and fries separately. UGGHH!!

I have enjoyed casual drinks, a few Das Boots, cups of chili, so many burgers, and so many mac n' cheese bites  and sampler appetizer baskets over the years...it's ridiculous. 

If you can get over the wait time, Dotty's is just a fun atmosphere all around. Amazing bar/Americana food done well. I have nothing else to add or take away. It's DELICIOUS.

It's not an issue for me, but Dotty's staff does not split bills either. You have to itemize your receipts yourself or pony up and combine cash/cards. When I've dine in groups, thankfully there has been an ambitious math-whiz present to take care of this issue...I just ain't got time for that!

I'm having issues finishing this review now...I want to devour a few burgers, fries, and appetizers. Gosh, I'll have to pay another visit soon!

Oh Dotty Dumpling's Dowry...how do I love thee?  Let me count the ways:

1.  Best burger ever.  Seriously.  I take back all the other times that I have thrown this out there and give you the crown.  The burger was perfectly cooked, the bacon was crispy and delicious, the Heart Throb sauce is divine, and the bleu cheese was perfect.
2.  BEAUTIFUL craft beer list.  There are plenty of awesome local brews on tap (I opted for some Ale Asylum beers), the list is organized by brewery (and state, OG reading, and IBUs are listed...swoon!), and there are also imports and domestics for the *other* drinkers as well.
3.  Fried Cheese Curds + English Garlic Sauce = HEAVEN.
4.  The actual restaurant is small and homey and inviting.  I love the speakeasy feel of the outside, the dark wood, the motorcycle paraphernalia, the old timey songs and music...But really? You had me at vintage betches with brews in the bathroom.

I don't think I can ever eat anywhere else in Madison ever again.  Thanks.
Best burgers in town! Nice low lighting atmosphere, atleast at night. Can't wait to go back again and again!

I'm from out of town and was visiting family in Wisconsin.  There were ten of us on two tables.  To start, there was a basketball tournament in the area, so there was no place to park that was close.  My mom uses a walker... No worries, the owner found a space for us.  Before we were seated I looked around at thought that this was a place I would have chosen.. Nice little bar, comfortable seating, crooners in the  background. Sage, the server was absolute phenomenal.. All the orders and special orders all gotten right .  The entire staff was fun, friendly and professional... I tried the two of the  different specialty sauces. one was a garlic Aoli... and the other was jalepeno cilantro, garlic, maybe sour cream... yummy.... my burger was awesome! very happy... this is a must return when I'm in town

I am usually not a big burger eater, but after checking out the menu online I was excited to go. I went with a group of girls I went to college with for our bi-annual reunions. The resturant is rather dark and the girl working at the hostess station looked like she would rather been walking over glass shards.... We were seated pretty quickly even though the resturant was busy. We ordered the combo basket which was great. The cheese curds and mushrooms are awesome. I ordered the Gladiator for my main meal. It was really really good. It has a thick slice of melted munster cheese, red onion, and an awesome sauce (the name escapes me). The sauce was a combo of mustard and mayo with black pepper corn and anchovie. Fantasic. I would go back again in a heartbeat!

When you walk in, it's immediately dark.  It doesn't feel like a burger joint, it feels like a burger restaurant.  Nice booths and friendly but slow service.

I got pretty excited while looking at the menu.  There were so many options.  I opted for the Melting Pot burger with the patty done medium.  When the burger came out, it looked good - nicely stacked.  But the first bite into it it was cold, room temperature at best.  The patty was mostly rare and not how a medium burger should be cooked.  The flavors of the cheeses and bacon was good, but the meat patty itself was seriously lacking - I could hardly taste it at all.  

Pretty sorry burger, if you ask me.   I'm hoping my burger was just sitting out cold while they were making the fries, which I ordered chili cheese style.  They tasted good and were hot and piping.  Yum!

Burger was wack.  My friend and I said we could have gotten better burgers at Five Guys (go there instead!).  

There's no excuse for a cold burger.
A visit to Madison is not complete without a stop here!  The cozy atmosphere and down to earth, delicious food keeps me and my hubs coming back.

All I can say is the food sucks. I visited two other burger places recently in Madison based on recommendations and they were great!!! Dotty's was terrible. I honestly have no idea how the hell this place got a good review. A coworker of mine who went to Wisconsin, also thought the food was ok, while another (who I now question his taste and intelligence) thought the burgers were good. All I can say, is that the other burger places I went to, were much, much better. I don't give harsh reviews unless the place deserves it. Well Dotty's is just no good. 


Well, I visited Dotty's for the second time because the cooks at Dotty's promised they didn't wipe their asses with their hands before they made my burgers. Unfortunately, they lied. I got sick again. Screw you Dotty's. Your sucks balls and made me sick. Twice. I'm a tax attorney & was a former assistant DA in Milwaukee. I want to sue you clowns in small claims so bad right now. Shut done & go out of business. Jerks!!!!!

I had great hope for this place based on reviews but was greatly disappointed. 

First problem was the beer. You do NOT serve quality micro-brews ice cold and in a frosty mug. With such a nice beer list, I figured they would know that but apparently not. It's great for the cheap mega-brews, but don't do that to my IPA. I was also quite surprised when my pint was $8!

The second problem was the burger. They had great potential but both burgers were nearly raw. I normally order my burgers medium, but these were rare.

I'm in heaven. A REAL burger, not tofu not vegan no gf bun but a REAL burger. I Ordered the Melting Pot with REAL CHEESE and REAL BACON. Lots of craft beers I washed mine down with a PBR baby!!!!!  I didnt order fries so I cant give a review on those. So if your looking for a non vegan burger on real bread this is the place to be!!!!!
Pretty good burgers not the best ive ever had but 4stars is pretty legit!

Such a cute name for a burger place! 

I'm not a native of Madison but this place screams "Madison" to me. It has a nice sized bar with lots of cozy booths for large groups of college students. I came here on  Friday night and it was pretty busy at the time but they were able to seat me and my boyfriend with no wait. Beer was amazing, but then again when is it not amazing in Madison? I had the lamb burger and it was topped off with a creamy feta cheese. My boyfriend had the buffalo burger. We split a large order of fries and shared a chocolate pie for dessert. All in all a great meal, except we were hungry an hour later. I'm not sure if that has to do with the food or the fact that me and my boyfriend are fatties.....it's probably the latter.

My burger, a vibrant blend of turkey, sage, and rosemary adorned by cranberry mustard and swiss, nestled within the boundaries of soft and sweet bun you need in a burger: transcendental. The cheese curds my fellow diners shared was all I had hoped for add a New Englander visiting beautiful Madison. The tap list... Wisconsin has some memorable and generally solid brews. Dotty's seems to be the sort of institution that locals can enjoy with visitors beside them. The wait staff is understanding and helpful. In the end it's the kind of place that you don't find often in a world of chains-dedicated to an experience and not a fad. A great meal and a must in Madison, namely if a burger is your immediate need.

Dotty Dumpling's Dowry supposedly has the best burger in Madison. I say it depends on what kind of burger you're in the mood for. The burger at Dotty's is maybe a half an inch thick, and drips with grease. I've had the bread completely fall apart under the weight of the patty. They're always cooked exactly right, but I suggest you get it a little more charred than normal if you don't want to get sick. It's just too much if your stomach isn't properly trained for it.

Now if you're looking for something that is thick and juicy, it is a pretty excellent burger. They have all sorts of varieties and special sauces that you can throw on the burger as well, but the standard cheese-lettuce-tomato-onion combination is probably the best one. The crazy sauces tend to get drowned out by the bloody meat sauce oozing out of the patty.

There's also a great beer selection to compliment your burger; the bar in here is way underrated. Amazing place to come just for a low-key drink.

One time, for a change of pace, I tried the jerk chicken sandwich. Terrible idea, it was completely dry and tasteless. Stick to ordering what Dotty's is good at - big burgers and fried comfort food.

Good food - Madison redefines bar food with such places. 

Beer, Chicken wings, milk shake. Life is good :)

A great plus that it is sooo close to campus and downtown - get both the student as well as the adult crowd. Always full, but that's a sign of a good place and what is the bar for??

Where do I start? Their burger ( no surprise since they're known for their burgers) was absolutely insane good and their fries tasted like they were maybe cut fresh. My friend got the buffalo chicken sandwich which was also amazing! I've been craving the burger since I left I'll definitely be back!

We were only in Madison for one night and wanted to get a good dinner while we were there. We jumped on yelp and found Dotty's was nearby and had great reviews so we ventured over. 
We got there probably around 730pm on a Wednesday night. It wasn't too busy and we were seated right away. Our server (who's name I forgot) came over right away to get our drink order. 
The menu isn't huge, but everything looked amazing. Especially the burgers, which is their specialty. We ordered a side of poutine, I had the Melting Pot, and my husband ordered the Gladiator. The poutine was amazing! Delicious gravy and a few fried cheese curds on top. SO GOOD. Big portion, too. The burgers are not HUGE... but they are good size. They both were AMAZING. The sauces were to die for! Especially the English Garlic. Just so good! 
The have a decent beer selection, too with local beers.. which we wanted to try. Our waiter was really good about helping with a beer recommendation, too. 
We are really happy we chose Dotty's as our one meal in Madison. It was awesome and I'd definitely recommend!
Hands down best spot for dinner or a date in Madison. The melting pot is the best hamburger in the whole world. And the macaroni and cheese wedges are the best appetizer in the whole universe.
Great place for a local burger thats juicy and done right. The fried wisconsin cheese curds are addicitvely good and gooey, perfect as a splurge to split with someone. Pretty affordable too

Very, very solid, cheap enough to go over and over, and the fries and cheesecurds are great.
Good to have a chat and hang out for a good half-hour.
A fantastic burger with a great selection. Pulled into Madison after a long day of driving and grabbed a burger here. It hit the spot!

Nice atmosphere. Interesting design throughout. Food is very good, very messy, and certainly worth eating.

There's a Pokéstop right inside to keep geeks (like me) and kids entertained. Had the curds, the fries, and the vanilla shake alongside my Southwest burger. Be wary of the mustard dipping sauce, it's got kick.

Overall I'd recommend it :)
Best burgers in America. For real. Plus, amazingly fresh curds, and solid local beer selection.
The food we ate was absolutely wonderful.  The server was very understanding that it was our first time there so she helped with suggestions and answered questions so we could order just enough food.

When we knew were going to be in town for a while I did some Yelp-Search to find a place to eat for lunch. Being particularly fond of the hamburger, we found a couple of locations that really looked good. In the interest of full disclosure the first place we went to was closed for renovations. I had actually planned on getting a burger at both places so we were going to go to Dotty's anyhow.
Dotty's was busy when we arrived and we have about a 20mn wait. Not bad at all and usually a good sign when a place is busy. We had already done our homework and knew what we wanted to order. I ordered the Pub burger with fries, my wife wanted to save herself for a special dinner and only went with the fried pickles. 
Our order arrived pretty quickly. I hit my burger right away. While my burger was cooked perfectly, the cheese was not melted. Munster cheese is usually a pretty good cheese to use for melting and this was not melted. My burger was supposed to have bacon and I don't recall seeing any bacon. Maybe it was cut up, just didn't stand out. While my burger was good, I felt it was missing some of the fat and goodness that I crave with a burger. The fries were good and I took every opportunity to dip them in what tasted like homemade ranch dipping sauce that came with my wife's fried pickles. The fried pickles by the way were very good. The pickles tasted homemade. They were crispy and the ranch dipping sauce was a perfect compliment. Dotty's has a lot of burgers and I would totally be up for trying some of their other burgers. Dotty's is an old school place and had I gone to school in Madison, I'd be there a few nights a week and on the weekends for a burger and a beer.

My goodness if Mary had a little lamb this place caught it and served it with onion rings ! The lamb burger was phenomenal!  Now the service is a flavor all it own and speaking of flavor my server saige is amazing she knows how to feed me and cayla is right there next to her too I eat these burgers daily and I work at a restaurant.  I love love love Dottys I'm on my way now

This is an iconic place for anyone from the area or if you went to school at UW Madison.  I hadn't been for about 20 years. The location has changed but the food...ohhhh the food. The burgers were ammmaazzziinng everything was but the burgers stood out. I consider myself to be somewhat of a burger connoisseur and this place definitely makes my top five list. 

We shared the fried mushrooms which were good, not the best I've ever had but definitely up there. We had the green and gold burger,  the melting pot burger, and a bison burger with just tomatoes and lettuce. We shared a basket of fries. Out of all the burgers the bison and melting pot were the top picks.

The service was 4.5 stars all the way. She seemed really busy and there were times when the wait was a bit long feeling but what lacked in promotness was made up for with her kindness and she just seemed to really like/enjoy her job.

I finally had the chance to stop here for lunch after having been meaning to do so for years. The burgers have a great reputation, and I wanted to check them out myself.

On arrival, the hostess had us seated in a few short minutes, and she, like all the employees we encountered, was very warm and friendly. The decor is jam-packed with whimsical items to keep your eyes from focusing on any one thing. I doubt you'd have a productive working lunch here if your attention span is anything like mine.

I ordered the Heart Throb burger, which had a touch of heat to it. The fries were hot and satisfying. The default cook on burgers is medium, which is a welcome change from the norm. Other orders at my table included a build-a-burger, which turned out great.

The burger variety, interesting decor, and friendly staff make for a winning combination here. Check it out.

YUMMMMMMY!! I thoughly enjoyed my burger. Our whole group did.
We also shared a sampler basket of all things fried. All thing delicious! Cheese curds, mac and cheese, onion rings, fries and mushrooms. It's more like heart attack basket but hey, all things in moderation, right?

GREAT ATMOSPHERE! I loved the old vintage charm of Dotty Dumplings!

If and I mean IF I had to make a complaint, I'd say server was a tiny but aloof, not enough to annoy me, but she could have check on us more. NOT a big deal really.

I don't live in Madison but do visit once or twice a year and you bet I'll return!!
 I love Dotty's!

I've had numerous burgers in my life from many locations across the world. The Melting Pot was one of the best burgers I've ever had in my life! Big statement right? 

I asked the sweet rental car lady where to go for a unique Madison meal...she came up with Cracker Barrel...ok, my fault, she was a waif, how would she know? So we went down to the little drag by UW and did a little tooling around. We went into a shop where we presented the same question, the kid behind the counter lit up and announced we needed to go to Dotty's. The other two associates chimed in with OMG, we have to get the Melting Pot. So we tried to keep as much of the directions in our heads as possible and were on our way. Couldn't find it..I said, ok, we need to ask someone that looked like they knew where good eats were. I picked a robust student with books and backpack if they knew where Dotty's burger place was. The sweet look of hardening arteries washed over the face and straightened me out. 

The place is indeed dark, the service is indeed slow. But the best burger and apps basket I've ever had. All the cheese curds, mac and cheese, mushrooms, etc. It was delicious. I enjoyed it soooo much that I decided to get a pint glass as a souvenir. The waitress charged me $5...and handed me a glass that had been well. I asked her if they had any new ones. She could not comprehend what "new" meant. I had to explain that for $5, I wanted a glass in a box, or at least without scratches and lipstick on it. So she did the next best thing. Washed it and put it in a brown paper bag. All I can say is, gotta love that midwestern charm.

I love the burgers at the DDD. I've been going to Madison for two weeks at a time for work. By far the best burgers I've come across and they're cooked to order. If you want a lighter lunch try the jambalaya and a side salad. Their cheese curds are delicious. They come with house made ranch and honey mustard for dipping. The employees have been cool about splitting up our group's tickets and also about splitting adult beverages onto additional tickets for those of us that can't put the drinks on corporate cards. If you're in Madison it's one of the places you must stop.

Dotty's burgers are great!. I like the build your own and this time I opted for a veggie patty. Lot's of cheese and topping options. The spicy veggie patty was pretty tasty. Made with black beans and it didn't crumble like veggie patties often do. My meat eating friends enjoyed their beef burgers. We also shared the fried mushrooms which were globs of crunchy goodness. Needless to say, my trip to Dotty's is not going into my fitness app! Good bar with a lots of beers with a good selection of local/Midwestern beers on tap. Half price pints at happy hour. Bartender was friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable on the beer offerings.

Visited Madison WI for the New Year's holiday weekend and Dotty Dumpling's was on the list of top things to do within this very cool city.  Needless to say, my family and I were certainly glad that it was... this place is amazing!

The atmosphere of the restaurant is cool; very college town feel to it.  We have a booth with a great view of the TVs to watch some college football.  Our hostess was super prompt and attentive. 

We ordered the cheese curds (its Wisconsin baby!) and each of us ordered one of their fabulous burgers.  No joke - these burgers are super fresh and grilled as if you were in someone's backyard on a summer's day.  We loved them!  

Washing down these tasty burgers with a flight of local beers made Dotty a must stop for me anytime I come back to Madison.

So why did we go into a burger place and not eat a burger? I think it has a lot to do with the fact that we "visited" a cow farm a couple of hours earlier where the babies were all kept in complete darkness and the dead adults were just thrown out on the road for their friends to look at. The smell was seriously something I've never dealt with before and, as much as I wanted to eat the hell out of 99% of their burger menu, I couldn't do it.

The fish fry and sampler basket of fried stuff were both good (especially the mushrooms.) I'm pretty sure they use a 50 pound fish for that fry. I really liked the salad I had with cranberries, walnuts and tuna, too.

I still don't understand why it wasn't possible to split up a check. It's not like we rolled in there with 15 people and needed 25 different checks. Four people and 2 checks seems like a pretty basic thing for a restaurant to do. Eh, whatever.

This place is too small for so many chairs...The atmosphere is that of a bar, and they serve bar food(fried) along with baked fish and etc...

Our experience was pleasant, the waitress was great, the food was tasty and arrived in a timely manner, it was hot. 

Everything is a la carte. So that means there is no deal for combo( sandwich and fries with drink). That also means they can charge high prices for each item, which they do. The service and atmosphere isn't electrifying enough for the prices of food.
Excellent vegeterian and vegan burgers with a good selection of sides!

Ordered wings as appetizer flavor was great and so was the value. Blue cheese had huge chunks super yum! Heartthrob burger I was expecting to have more of a punch of flavor. Fries were super crispy and fresh. Service was good! I would def recommend! I took off one star bc of the burger

Five stars for ambience alone! Food, service, beer selection all worth five stars as well... Just so rare to find a place that really nails it on sound and creature comfort. Place was packed, but bar was still perfectly intimate setting thanks to great lighting, well thought out sound absorption, mindful staff & quiet evening music. Just perfect.

For the best burger place in Madison, I award it to Dotty Dumpling's.

In fact, they specialize in burgers and have a huge selection of them on their menu. Even if, in the extremely rare occasion, you blasphemously don't want one of Dotty Dumpling's original or alternative burgers, there is always the option to build your own. 

Unfortunately, I cannot recommend my favorite burger here; it's because I tried most of them and was not disappointed each time I went. If you're in the mood for a heart attack, however, I'd go for the Melting Pot burger. Sometimes I get the Aphrodite burger in an attempt to falsely trick myself into thinking it is a healthier option. 

Regardless, if you want a quality burger, head over to Dotty Dumpling's.
Great burgers and fries with gourmet fixings.  Go early on a weekend.  It was quite full by 5:30 on a Saturday,

The cheese curds here were delicious, definitely the best I have had in Madison! The burger, on the other hand, was so-so. I got the Runnelstone, which had english garlic sauce and grilled onions. The burger was juicy and good, but the bun was bad. It was so floppy and soggy that I wish I had used a fork and knife. Get some pretzel buns Dotty! Then I'd bump you up to a 5.

Great burger. I had a spicy number with their signature jalapeño-cilantro cream cheese. Good fries. Environment was good for a biz lunch, family, or friend outing. Tall wood booths. Comfortable lighting. TVs, but not a sports bar. $20 for two sandwiches, shared order of fries, and a soda. I'll be back.
Soggy bun killed the burger for me. Meat was actually quite good. Also like the cheese curds and the fries. Grilled onions not so great on the burger.

Dotty Dumpling's Dowry is a great place but you can't see that from the outside. Best thing to do is just go in, I assure you, Dotty's is charming. Wood booths, smaller but not boutique, cool decor, Marilyn Monroe movies playing with the sound turned down so you can hear the jazz music. And I am not into jazz but it suits this place so well.

We got a table right away. Service was good. Our server knew what was good on the food and beer menus and made a couple great recommendations. The food is mostly casual and that was alright by us. We started with an appetizer sampler basket which has fried cheese curds, fries and more along with dipping sauce. For dinner we had burgers. All were cooked as we had ordered them; medium, rare and medium rare.

Prices reasonable and we scored street parking.
If you wanted something that was healthy, you wouldn't be here. This may be the best burger in Madison, but even if it isn't, it's firmly among the first class. Eat local!
Great bar food. The curds are yummy and burger was pretty good. Nothing mind blowing but totally worth visiting while in town!
This is THE BEST hamburger I have EVER EVER EVER eaten in my life. The service was excellent, and the food...whilst presentation lacking, had the most rich flavor I have ever experienced in my life.

I had the lamb burger on special for lunch. Fantastic flavor!  Like that they keep malt vinegar on table. The green and gold burger was un-spectacular. We got seated right away because it was right when they opened. We stay frequently at fluno right across street and we always see a line out the door. Dark wooded decor. Fun memorabilia. Mac n cheese bites were the same as at Vintage except that Vintage has slightly better ranch.

As someone who is not necessarily crazy about burgers, I have to say I really enjoyed Dotty's. I also have several strange food allergies and am usually limited in what I can select from the menu. I was able to try something unique at Dotty's without fear of ending up in the hospital.

The burger I tried was delicious - definitely not a reheated frozen patty. The service was friendly and the appetizers and sides were just as good as the burgers. We get fried cheese curds wherever we go, and Dotty's are up there with the best.
It's awesome! Best part you can switch all burgers with chicken and/or vegetarian patties! Try the pesto mozzarella burger. Fresh and tasty

In town yesterday for a job interview and we stopped in here on a suggestion from a friend and we are already planning a trip back! 

The atmosphere is fantastic, dimmed with pin up-esqe art and black and white films on the televisions(I'm sure this may change through the week, but this was early Monday afternoon). The namesake coming from a Sir Arthur Conan O'Doyle reference was a winner with me as well.

We were sat right away and our waitress came promptly for drinks. I wish I would've got her name, she was extremely pleasant, seemed to really enjoy her job, not pushy in the slightest and had fantastic sleeve tattoos.

Our food came quickly and was absolutely magnificent! 

Ordered: Heart throb and fries, the heart throb sauce is a jalapeno sauce so I was unable to try it to vouch(I would've been in tears!) But I was assured it was perfect.

I had the alumni and fries. The custom steak sauce was delicious and the burger itself was cooked to perfection! 

We wolfed our meals in less than 20 minutes and were pleasantly stuffed! 

The bill was not as painful as I feared for everything being ala carte, around $23 for two full meals(no booze this time). 

All in all, this was a very pleasant experience with the best burger I have ever had and I can't wait to return!
The burgers were decent, but they weren't worth the cost with how tiny they were.  I can think of a number of burger joints in Madison that are much better.

Good jambalaya and ok chili (the cheese is a slice just plopped on top) and cornbread... Great beer... But that's all I could eat. I have a severe fish allergy and it was that or a few of their salads (nothing with any meat though). Very disappointing that they hadn't thought about cross contamination with allergies. I'll go back for the soup and definitely the beer but it'll only be with friends... Not by myself. And only if other people suggest it. Very disappointing.

Great burgers that you can customize! Seasoned and cooked the right way. Our server Tom was great and made us out of towners feel special . We would have went back twice but didn't have enough time. Bummer! You can't go wrong here,no way no how!

Cheese Curds- 2 out of 5 curds
Tiny, bite-size cheese curds, pretty adorable in size. Nothing too special in terms of fried cheese curds, just average. Pile of good poppin fun to eat. 

Sweet Potato Fries- 4 out of 5 curds
Delicious! Not sure if it's because they are made from sweet potatoes or what, but these tasted far less greasy and guilty to eat than regular fries. Very skinny shoestring fries that don't make you feel fat eating them. 

Mac 'n Cheese Wedges- 5 out of 5 curds
Mmmmmm. This was the first place I had ever encountered this native Sconnie delicacy. I wasn't really sure what to expect when I bit into the light-colored wedge, but an explosion of warm, cheesy Mac n cheese filled my orifice. Would definitely do this again. 

Southwest burger (w/ bleu cheese & tomato) - 2 out of 5 curds
For claiming to be the best burgers in town I'd have to disagree. The Southwest burger is a medium rare beef patty topped with cheddar cheese, bacon, and a special BBQ sauce. I substituted for the pungent yet addictive bleu cheese. And added tomato. The burger presentation was poor, a bit sloppy and disappointing to the eyes. The buns look and taste pretty cheap and low quality. The burger was built in such a sloppy manner any chance at a civilized biting approach was shot. Bacon was good. Cheese was good. The tomato slice provided a nice fresh contrast. So we're the pickle slices that almost fooled our table into being cucumbers just by there appearance. Regardless of the presentation I inhaled the burger after the hour long wait to sit and another hour wait for food. 

Since the star of this review should have been the burger since Dotty's claims to have the best in town I was pretty disappointed. Would not return for a burger, but might for the Mac n cheese wedges if I can't find them somewhere else around town. 

Giant pickle is cool.

Big hype about this place, I suppose it's okay. Build your own burger spot. The burger that I asked to be medium was quite rare. Just felt like they were trying to rush us out of there. In fact, you can't stay longer than an hour per their policy. Dark and crowded with kitschy Wisconsin decor, it's better than your average pub.

YUM
YUM
YUM
Is there more to say? BEST place for a beer and burgers!! Brought friend who is a chef and he says HANDS DOWN the BEST burger he's ever had.  ALWAYS worth the mula and wait.  THANK YOU!!!
Best burger in the state! They are also able to accommodate my son's peanut and tree nut allergies.

Sweet find, great brew selection, and loved my buffalo burger. Staff was friendly and the bar area comfortable. Couple cuties working their, one with a particular sweet smile, always a plus. This place deserves a place on State St.

Need something hearty after a day of perusing through Downtown Madison, or a late night bite after indulging into one too many adult beverages?  You've found the right place.  Dotty Dumpling's Dowry is an old fashioned bar/restaurant that provides just good ol' American, stick to the bones, comfort food.  

I ordered the special of the nice which was a truffle burger, and it did not disappoint.  The burger itself was cooked a perfect medium.  It was juicy, buttery, and unbelievably savory.  The condiments were also done well.  The truffle was not over done and it enhance the flavor of the beef.  

As for the sides, we ordered fried pickles, cheese curds, and chili cheese fries.  The fried pickles and cheese curds were what you would expect.  They were fried, battered, and delicious, but nothing out of the norm.  The chili fries though was far from the norm because it was coated with Dotty's famous chili.  The chili was hearty, full of spice, and had actual pieces of beef tips and pork tenderloin.  Using that chili with quality sharp cheddar on a bed of crispy fries was a perfect marriage.  

Dotty's is classic Americana, and if you are looking quality food and a welcoming atmosphere, you've found the right place.

Stopped in with my wife and son. We all got different chicken sandwiches. All had buns that fell apart and got very soggy, and nobody likes wet bread. On the bright side, we all liked the flavor. The truffle fries were a disappointment, though, because they were very stingy with the truffle aioli. Prices were a little steep for what you get. Service was good.
Wonderful service. Food came out piping hot. Yummy burger. I would definitely come back here for another burger!!

I was let down by a lot of Hamburger America's suggestions, but this one might have been the best.  The burgers are grilled and delicious.  They also have fried cheese curds which are awesome and a good beer selection.

I was visiting from out of town and came here based on the other Yelp reviews.  
Atmosphere - great!  We really enjoyed the decor and the obvious "college town" vibe.  
Food - awesome.  The burgers, the buns, fries, salads, cheese curds were perfect
Drinks - great beer selection with local brews
Service - was a problem.  I specifically told the server we wanted to take our time.  I asked for space between appetizer, salad, and entree so we could enjoy or beer and conversation.  Salads came out minutes after the appetizer and burgers within seconds of the salads.we were made to feel incredibly rushed. 

If I lived around here, I would definitely return for the great food and atmosphere.   I would just make sure to order one course at a time.

So my co worker and I were on a business trip and were staying downtown Madison. I got a really bad craving for Burgers, Cheese Curds, and Beer! 

Looked up a few places around the hotel and found this gem!

We came in and grabbed a seat at the bar and immediately ordered the spotted cow and some fried cheese curds. Both were amazing and I highly recommend them to anyone visiting the DDD. We then ordered the spinach salad and two burgers: The Pub Burger and the Classic Burger. We ended up splitting both burgers but after eating half of the Pub Burger, I regretted splitting it because IT WAS AMAZING! Honestly, the best burger I've ever had. It had an onion jam which was so delicious. Oh and the cheese sauce basically made the burger. I can't say enough about it! The staff were great, super helpful and so sweet! Can't wait to come back for
another work trip!

Dotty's is the classic burger in Madison. I've been eating here for 25 years and the food continues to be solid. From the stadium, to the capital to its current location, I am just a little happier when I walk inside.  Great atmosphere, great location, great food. I do miss the Banana Creme Pie. Try a burger and shake; then have a beer, You'll feel like a new man. This is a must visit.

This place is one of my favorite burger places in town.  Usually it can be very crowded so plan accordingly.  I've tried many different burgers and they have all been great.  So far my only complaint is that sometimes when the burger makes it out the bun is already soggy.  The fries are great and a large size is a great sharing portion.  Don't forget about the milkshakes, which they will also split for you as well if asked.

I'm all about Dotty's.

The interior is nice and dark and full of random things on the walls, and seating is pretty secluded.

Love the menu, there are a lot of options, but I traditionally go for the Melting Pot Burger, which is pretty freaking amazing.

They have a lot of great choices for dipping sauces for fries and cheese curds.

It is a pretty popular place, and is located right by the Kohl's Center, so if you aren't careful about when you go, you might not get a table.

Not as good as the old Dotty's. You know the one. The one they had to tear down. Maybe it wasn't that good and I'm just being nostalgic, but the new one just feels more like an Applebee's. Although their cheese curds are slammin'.

Used to be great, now just okay. The burgers are the best in Madison conceptually but are not consistently prepared the best. Unique interior styling has given way to bring a poorly lit TGI Friday's. Malts are still great. More of a great nostalgia trip than a great restaurant at this point.

Great food, good prices and outstanding service. Out server Becka was very friendly and cheerful. The food came out very quickly. I had a chicken Cesar salad. My daughter had the fish fry and both were excellent

Really disappointing takeout experience. I was quoted 15 minutes and it took 30. When my bag was given to me, I double checked and was missing an item. I got the bag back with all three items. When I got home, I saw that my "rolls royce" burger had no bacon. I also had a side of honey mustard, which made no sense for my order. I would not do takeout from them ever again.

Great food, great service; not to be missed in Madison. Our server was friendly with the kids and spoke knowledgeably about the food and beer. Two huge thumbs up for the burgers! The kids grilled cheese was basic, but that is a good thing with the tiny pallets of little ones. The server also asked on the sly if we wanted the ice cream sandwiches that comes with the kids meals. Thoughtful to ask on the down low.
Will come again.

This place rocks. 
It looks like a bar with tons of history.
Staff is super friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive.
The vibe is like a bar but intimate.

The food here is great.
The burgers are made to order the way you want, the garlic sauce goes perfect on the burgers to me. My favorite burger here is the kobe beef burger but even then compared to the other burgers  beef, bison,  chicken lamb etc etc it becomes a tough choice. Next time I'm in town I might just try one of each lol, yes they are that great and flavorful.

The cheese curds are awesome here.

Really can't say anything bad about this place.
I do wish it was a chain lol that is available all over the country. It beats shake shack etc etc. 

Give it a shot if you are in Madison

Boyfriend and I come here a lot for apps and drinks, and we always have a good time. I like the ambiance here, it is very warm and pub-like. We have sat both at the bar and at a high-top--both were nice. I recommend getting the sampler appetizer--it is has cheese curds, deep fried mushrooms, deep fried mac and cheese bites, and onion rings. The ranch sauce is amazing!

What keeps me coming back is the beer selection. I like trying new beers (with boyfriend's recommendation, of course) and I always find something I have never heard of here. 

This is a great place to take the family when they are in Madison visiting or a nice place for dinner/drinks with friends. Because of the warm, pub-like aura, I feel like this is a great place to go for dinner or a date in the winter months.

Went with my boyfriend on a Monday night and thoroughly enjoyed Dotty's.  My biggest complaint was that the A/C was cranked and I was a little chilly during dinner.  Our server was nice and took good care of us.  The chocolate shake and root beer float were really good and the food was excellent and quickly served.  My green and gold burger was awesome with fried pickles and bacon mayo.  My boyfriend got the chili dog with cheese curds and they were both delicious as well.  Nothing fancy but the perfect burger :)
Burger was good, a bit difficult holding it while eating, but well worth the effort. Enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere. Oh, and the winds were 20+ mph!

Came here and sat at the bar. Atmosphere was cool, service was so-so. Ordered a burger (no fries) and cheese curds. The a la carte pricing made those two items together total almost $20.00. I'm definitely not cheap when it comes to food, but $ 12.00 for a so-so burger is expensive- especially in Madison, WI!

Dotty's is probably the best place to grab a burger in Madison. I love their southwest burger and sweet potato fries. Don't miss their shakes, which are really good. Their "sundae" is disappointing: hard vanilla ice cream with cold syrup, not hot fudge. 

Every time I've eaten at Dotty's I've had to wait in their cramped lobby. Thankfully, I've always been seated quickly. Prices are average, which is nice for the student crowd.

As a visitor to Madison, I read a lot of reviews of places to gt burgers and curds. I selected DDD since it was within walking distance of my hotel and the reviewer notes that they have the best curds in town.

My party of 6 arrived around 3 on a Sunday, but the place was hopping, so we had to all sit in a booth (it was a little crowded, but we were so hungry that we did not care).  Our server took our drink and curd order and left us to peruse the various options.  The menu is pub food--very heavy on the burgers (which was fine, since that is what we wanted), but one companion did wonder...why does a place with dumpling in the name, not serve some sort of dumpling (I think she misunderstood what type of food would be available).

We all opted for local beers and burgers of a wide variety. Although the burgers do not come with fries, the 2 orders of curds were plenty to supplement the large burgers topped with delicious items (I had the green and gold with cheese and fried pickles). It was well cooked and totally hit the spot.  The curds were also delicious (although I would have to argue of the curds that i sampled on my trip, they were second to those at Graze--see my review of Graze for much more praise).

This is totally a bar that serves great bar food. Do not come here looking for anything else, but if you want that, you are in luck. They only thing that was slightly creepy were the figurines/dolls above the bar...I was not looking at them, but one of my dining companions could not stop looking at them (choose your seat wisely if dolls/clowns creep you out).

Very nice place. I was there after the university had just let out so it was not packed at all. Super nice and attentive bartenders. Menu is mainly burgers, but there is something for everyone (even vegetarians). Was in town on business and ate here 2 of 3 nights because it was that good and relaxing. Met the owner and his son who were incredibly gracious.

Wow, amazing burgers go along with amazing service! Haris was probably the best server I've ever had, what a genuine guy! 
Thanks Dotty's!
Fun atmosphere, great beer selection, amazing burgers and the BEST fried pickles I've ever eaten- SO GOOD!! The service is really great, too.

This is it.  Go here when you are in Madison.  The burgers are good, but its the fried food with their GARLIC DIP  that is the best part.  Cheese Curds are a requirement or you didn't actually go to DDD.

Oh Dotty's....I knew ye when ye were a two story staple on State Street.  The new location isn't the same, but it is still wonderful.  Big wooden booths and the perfect dark brew-pub atmosphere.  My girlfriends and I hit it up when we are craving a big juicy burger...we love the Melting Pot Burger and the Swiss and Mushroom.  The fries are also fantastic, but you have to buy them seperately.  My mouth is watering thinking about those fantastic burgers....5 Stars.

Maybe I just hit Dotty's on a bad day. I found the burgers and the service just OK. The garlic mayo for the fries, that is another story, that would be a hands down 5 stars. :) When I bite into a burger I am looking for juice to start running down my chin. That didn't happen. My burger was overdone. Our server did not seem thrilled to be serving us. 

Reading all the other reviews, it does seem it was an off day. I will definitely be back to try it again.

Ok. So you normally have to wait awhile to sit, but it's always worth the wait. A+ burgers. I never leave here feeling anything less than fully satisfied. Thought about giving 4/5 but had to give 5/5 purely out of my experience always being great, regardless of how long I had to wait. Great food and memories at Dotties.

This isn't much I can say that the other yelpers haven't said already. This place is cool! The burger parties are terrific. I didn't get much info from the busy but helpful bartender but I learned they locally source as much as possible. I had the green and gold which was cooked just as I asked and it was dynamite on a brioche style bun. 
Big enough for any appetite but if I had a second chance I'd skip the fries and get 2 burgers. 
The fries were also excellent and the small portions was anything but "small" don't get the large unless you are a really hungry person. Don't pass up the opportunity to try the garlic mayo which went really well with the fries. 
This is a slightly divey pub with a comforting atmosphere and a friendly crowd. Lots of beers on tap and a well healed liquor selection. 
There is no parking except the street which has automated meters. 
Go try the burger I think it's a total hit!

Burgers and fries. At their best. I dare say quite possibly the best burgers in Madison (in the old school burger category).

My favorite burger is probably the toadstool with swiss and wild mushrooms, but many other combinations look extremely appealing too. The runnelstone or the heartthrob or the bayou just to name a few.
They also have a variety of patties you can choose from: regular beef, bison, vegetarian, vegan, lamb, turkey... you name it. And they are delicious both medium rare and well done.

I like the fries and the onion rings too and I heard great things about the cheese curds, but I've always been here for lunch and cheese curds seem to be a bit on the heavy side if you're off to work afterwards.

The one problem with this place is service. It can be incredibly slow. Not always, but sometimes it can take 40 minutes to get a burger during lunch rush. Not fun. Also some of the servers are totally clueless.

Anyway, they do their burgers very well. And until that is true I will brave the service.

My mouth started watering when I typed in the name of this place to review it.  The burgers are so big, but not too big, with so many options that there's something to please everyone (except vegetarians, since half of the menu is burgers and the other half is chicken sandwiches).  Whether you want a burger dripping with multiple kinds of cheese, bursting with bacon, or piled high with veggies, this is the place to go.  Conveniently located just off of State Street to draw a slightly tamer crowd, the restaurant is large enough to handle even the largest Game Day crowds. 

Oh!  And get the cheddar munchers (deep fried mac 'n cheese bites) to start the meal- since the burgers don't come with fries, it's almost easy to justify the extra cheese :)

Dotty's make great burgers, but the secret is in the various sauces. 

I shared the Heart Throb, with a creamy, jalepeno-like sauce and the Runnelstone, which is served with an English Garlic sauce. Both were delicious. As our waiter put it: "I'd eat anything with the English garlic sauce on it." 

The fried cheese curds were classic Wisconsin, bready and salty and come with your choice of dipping sauces. Did I mention the sauces?

The place has an old-timey feel, and families seem to frequent the place despite being right next to one of the nation's largest university campuses. Howling college kids vs screaming children...it's a push. 

Overall, I'd recommend it for a great burger and a beer. Lots of New Glarus and Bells on tap.

Not a bad first stop in Madison.  Had the ginger beer and the ale asylum taster (not much pineapple in the hoppy beer, dark one was the best) to drink. 
Had the spinach salad which had decent dressing, Gorgonzola cheese, cranberries, walnuts. Pretty tasty. 
The burgers were tasty but almost too big for a single person.
Typical stop for a local Madison

My all time favorite place to get a burger!

Just a scrumptious beef patty I can't feel I can compare to any other establishment!

Mustard is a must!

The malts are mighty tasty too!

I had the walleye on my most recent visit, which was pretty tasty!

All the antiques and such fixated throughout are legit!

I've been going ever since the last location on N Fairchild St!

Pretty sure I was at that location on their last day too!

Believe It!
I only come here for one food: Jumbo Fries with Garlic Sauce. That's it, I'm one happy person after eating it.
Came in for the dumplings, sorry no dumplings you have to come in and read the story. Awesome bison burger and the onion rings where great. Will come again.

Let me preface: I use Yelp all the time to search for restaurants, but I basically never post reviews until now. Dotty dumplings is that good. 

I've lived in Madison for three years, and this place has the best burger I've tried in the city (I got the toadstool - delicious)! It was cooked perfectly, and the cheese, mushrooms and sauce complimented the beef beautifully.

The waitress was also incredibly friendly and prompt. I was there at 1:00 PM on a Monday afternoon, so there weren't many people there, but the food and check were very quick.

Would absolutely go back - the burger was de-freaking-licious.

I was told that this place has the best burgers in town and I am impressed.  I can't get over the name!

Very reasonable price ($5-7 burgers), especially given that it's a nice sit-down atmosphere, cozy, and with good service.  Other people seem to complain about the service but the one time I came here, it was very good.  The place was moderately busy when we were here, but the waitress was attentive and friendly and we received our food promptly.

I ordered the California burger, which had bacon, guacamole, tomato, and sprouts, and it was outstanding.  It could have easily been too greasy, but instead, it was light and the vegetables very fresh.  And, they do have a good beer selection too, which is an extra bonus!
Amazing food, amazing service! Melting pot burger was awesome! Will be back again next time we're in town! The garlic mayo was delicious.

The Melting Pot Burger + Fried Cheese Curds = Heaven. It was soo good and filling that I almost didn't finish it!

This place competes for "Best Burger in Madison" with all the cheese + special sauce they put on their burger!

A Craigslist Purchase landed us in the Madison area, so we thought we'd give this burger place a try.  My hubbie had found it previously on Yelp and had it on his wishlist of places to try.  While as you read in the other reviews, that the place is great... there are just a few things I would mention/share with those who would be interested.

- When they mean pink center for the bugers... they mean pink!  Yumminess!

- The Chili Cheese Fries are great, but they come with a ton of chili peppers and onions


Parent Notes:
- Great kids menu with burgers, grilled cheese, hot dog, corn dog & chicken fingers as the entree.  Apple sauce, fries are two of the side options.  Kiddie cocktails, soda, juice (no apple) or milk (choco too!)  are options for the drink.  All for $4.99

- The Booths are a little akward sized... there is no overlap between the table and the booth its self - so my toddler in a booster seat slipped a few times.  Luckily I had one of those handy table attached seats in the car, which worked great!

- Being in a campus town, there was enough noise from people talking that my toddler making lots of noises was not notices.  But enough families that we didn't feel like outsiders.

This burger was delicious and amazing as promised by the staff at the Masison Concourse! There was a game about to start when I tried to get a seat at this hot spot, so rsther then wait, it was suggested by the hostest to order to go at the bar, which I did. Sara the bar tender was such a sweet woman who made me an amazing Old Fashion for $7 as I awaited my food! Which was better then the one I've tried at Johnny Delmanacos. The staff were all very nice and friendly. Great establishment. Very Impressed.

Great cozy burger place.  Neat, eclectic decor.  Friendly and efficient wait staff.  

We had cheese curds as a starter, very tasty and done just right.  Also had the fried pickles, thought they were ok.  

Had a classic burger.  Wow that was terrific.  Very tasty sauce, nice toppings and great bun.  Great french fries.  

Paired with a spotted cow.  

Over all very tasty.

Would definitely come back again to this lovely establishment.

Menu says "all burgers come medium-pink unless otherwise requested" but our entire table received well done burgers. Plus they're about the size of McDonald's patties, not very impressive. At least they tasted good due to all the toppings!
The cheese curds and the hamburgers are awesome! They also have a nice selection of cold and good beer!

Best burgers in Madison. Avoid ordering to-go but great for sitting down with a beer and some cheese curds. 

Maytag blue cheese and bacon burger gets my vote for best overall burger in the state. The "melting pot" with their English garlic sauce is rich, silky, and delicious. Good onion rings, fries, and fried mac and cheese squares, though cheese curds have declined in recent years. They used to have the best curds in town too.

Burgers, when prepared correctly, are wonderful. The big detraction is that their buns are infamously crumbly and stale. I've had some of the most delicious meals in town here, though they need to change their buns and make sure burgers are cooked to the requested temperature every time. I'm also surprised but happy to say that I think Dotty's has the best salads in town. Generous fresh portions of roughage and veggies.

Service is basically a rotating menagerie of soon-to-be-fired UW students. To-go orders always come home wrong. If you go in looking to chill and not worried about service, especially during off hours, this one of the great places to sit down with a Spotted Cow and Wisconsin junk food. A great place for tourists to get a feel for Madison too.

A restaurant to stand the test of time! I am a regular, my partner requests it to be ready at the bus stop whenever she visits Madison. 

Still one of the three best burgers in Madison, with Brothers Three and Weary Traveler. 

Very consistent quality, no disappointments with anything I or my companions have ever ordered. 

I particularly like the Heartthrob, Grand dad, Toadstool, Bison, Bayou, Melting Pot burger. The salmon salad is great. 

You MUST order the sample basket. 

You will not get a table on game day. Don't even try.

I like to come to Dotty's after work sometimes for an old-fashioned and a burger. The place is a little touristy, but I'd prefer that to a rowdy college fratboy scene. The drinks are reasonably priced, and the burgers are good if not rather messy (almost to the point of being annoying on several occasions). The one thing I will note is that the bar staff is at times somewhat inattentive. Towards the end of the night (they close at midnight) you might find them at the end of the bar near the grill chatting with coworkers while you wait to place an order or your glass is empty. Other than that, this place is worth checking out if you in the neighborhood.
Delish. If you're in the mood for burgers, hot dogs, and chili fries, this is your place. I even got the bbq chicken salad and it was great. Super fun atmosphere and music, too.
The atmosphere was incredible and with the jazz and black and white tv shows playing and the food was some of the best I've had and is in my definite top 5 burgers.

This place had really good burgers. I have the granddaddy burger and it was really good my girlfriend had the pub burger and it was good as well but she had a hair on it. The waitress told us that she would have replaced it we would've told her but my girlfriend just ate it anyways. Overall the beers are really cold. Great atmosphere. Cheese curds french fries and then it rings were really really good. I would definitely go back. The granddaddy burger is the Kirby and it was delicious.

Great burger, and chili fries. The chili there was as described, with the chunks of meat. Good chili flavor, nice amount of chile on the fries. Loved it, and they put some nice hot peppers on. Had the bayou burger, wife and I both thought it was well covered with the onion strips, and the sauce was tasty, spicy (for her, I added extra hot sauce). Good burger to bun ratio I thought. Had a house salad to help the digestion ;-) can't say if it is best in town since I haven't been to all but it was better than our favorite place back home...
Tasty, but very greasy burger. This is a great place for a quick unhealthy lunch, or to take out-of-state visitors for exactly the food they are expecting to eat in Wisconsin.

Best burger I've ever eaten was here: The Runnelstone. Juicy, sloppy, medium well goodness on a bun that was able to handle it and keep it all together, add cheddar cheese, their signature garlic sauce,  and fried onions to that mix and damn my mouth was in it for the long haul. The fries were decent, as well, our waitress attentive and quick to get our orders in and food to our table. The atmosphere was great, the lighting was dim and we were sat in a corner that hid us away from everyone with the high wooden backs to our booth. Twilight Zone was playing on the t.v. above our heads but it was close captioned so we could take it in or ignore it which made our experience enjoyable. 

You want a good burger you come here. They have at least four concoctions of their own making that have made them famous. They also serve lamb burgers, which I just have to try next time.

This is my favorite restaurant in my home town. Staff is full of unbelievably engaging fun and attentive smoke shows. I recommend Stanley's blue ribbon w a veggie patty added on top and a side of sweet potatoe fries. If it's leg day add a vanilla malt with a slice of fudge bottom pie in it, or a Travis Haases Apple Pie Alamode Vanilla Malt.
Great wait staff...really nice.  stopped by for lunch yesterday.  food was ok, nothing special...had the chili. Yummy chocolate malt!

We were tired after a long day and this place with its unique name definitely caught my eye.  As this is a straight food review (we ordered take out and brought it back to the hotel), I'll stick to my typical pro's and con's.

Pro: Good sourcing, good products, very good portion size (just got a burger, no side).  Cooked perfect (medium, woo!  Not overdone at all!) and nice crisp toppings.  I got the lamb burger.  Very tasty and hit the spot.

Con's: Well, I shouldn't say con's, but more 'suggestions'.  For Dotty's, when take out is ordered, it would be nice to mark which burger is which.  Sometimes it's hard to tell.  Luckily, my feta cheese is easy to catch.  For the take out patron, the food cools down quick.  Still good, but I know my burger would have tasted that much more awesome if it had been hotter.  Still really good, but next time, we'll eat in.  It's a la carte, folks, so just remember, fries are extra.

If you want a really good burger in Madison, be sure to check this place out.

Folks if you ever find yourself in Madison, Wi stop by. Someone call the food network they have obviously missed one of best burger places in America. 

We all have that nostalgic place from our hometown or college where we thought the food was the "bomb" ( that's right I'm dating myself). This place is where you take the parents for a good affordable fun meal before you hit them up for cash and leave until Thanksgiving. 

I had the a burger with three different takes of cheese and bacon with their house garlic sauce. It came with a side of fries that you dream about crisp, pillowy and hot. These were the best fries I've had in years. I actually given up on fries because no one does them right until now. 

I'm only in Madison for 3 days but I may have to break my rules and return to this place. It makes me wonder will I miss another really good place while I'm in town.

It's funny because six years ago, my review would have been 5 stars.  Not so much now.  I used to eat at Dotty's all the time at the old location.  Now that it's moved, I think I've been there once.

I love the burgers, cheese curds, and the fries, but now that it's a sit-down place with waiters and stuff, I feel like their kind-of-pricey-burgers should be like a meal thing.  

I guess what it really is, is that old place was a lot more fun.  The new location seems like it has more of a "I just drove my SUV 40 miles to see a hockey game in Madison and now I'm hungry" feel to it.

Wisconsin cheese belongs on Wisconsin burgers. A staple for the kids of UW Madison, this tavern-style restaurant offers a lot in the way of burger selection. I enjoyed the Runnelstone immensely and the garlic sauce, though very heavy in mayo, was darn tasty. I also enjoyed the basket of fried deliciousness that came as an appetizer. Fried Cheese Curds are better than any cheese in California.
Fantastic as always! You simply can't go wrong with your menu choice. We love the food, service and the atmosphere. My favorite for cheese curds! A real Madison gem.

Creatively named burgers adorn the menu at Dotty Dumpling's Dowry, like the Heart Throb, the Melting Pot, and the Billy Goat. We decided to stop in for lunch before getting our drive to Milwaukee underway, and we immediately set to work trying to choose from among the many char grilled sandwich options.

We started things off by ordering fried cheese curds from our friendly waitress, and they were excellent with a side of ranch, or particularly with the English Garlic sauce that also comes on some of the burgers. I ultimately decided on the Gladiator burger which, while it sounds imposing, was actually a quite manageable burger. Biting into the soft, buttery buns, the burger was charred at the edges yet pink and juicy in the middle, in this case stacked with Muenster cheese, bacon, red onions, and their special Boomerang sauce: a mustard blend that is sure to keep you coming back. One of my companions got what is perhaps Dotty's signature burger, Stanley's Blue Ribbon, and was duly impressed with the cream cheese, BBQ sauce, and onion ring topped burger. There are many other compelling "adventurous alternatives" on the menu, like the buffalo, turkey, or veggie burgers, or the tantalizing Mediterranean style lamb burger with feta cheese. I only wish we had more time in Madison to give them a whirl.

The name Dotty Dumpling's Dowry calls to mind some greasy spoon diner with a hair-netted waitress named Flo with a pencil tucked behind her ear. But in actuality, Dotty's is a nice place with dark wood, elegant fixtures, vintage aerospace models hanging from the ceiling, and old movies playing on several of the TV's. Dotty's is certainly Madison's hamburger headquarters.

This place is amazing. The cheese curds were the best I've ever had. The melting pot burger is amazing everyone should try it. My boyfriend had the kobe beef burger and that was a whole different level. I can't believe I hadn't tried this place before. The service was amazing and the selection of beers was great.
Wonderful burgers and great sauces.  A bit pricey and most of the offerings are a la cart but it's worth going.

If Dotty's was in Chicago it would be a very popular spot and I'd be there all the time. Luckily, Madison is not too far from Chicago and when I come up for a Badgers game or just to visit, I take in Dotty's for their ridiculously good burgers and their selection of fine Wisconsin beers.  Where else can go get a pitcher of New Glarus Spotted Cow and a burger with English garlic sauce, swiss, cheddar and provolone, and bacon? This would be the melting pot burger and it would be delicious.

The meat is fresh ground chuck and it's juicy and always cooked to order. The Runnelstone and the Black and Blue are good bets and next time I'm in I'll try something else.  Burgers are priced about standard for the quality you get and extra toppings like bacon, jalapeno bacon, roasted red pepper or sauteed mushrooms are $0.75 extra.  The burgers don't come with fries but you get a lot for $2. Or, go for fried cheese curds, fried mushrooms, onion rings or other goodies.  

If cow meat is not your thing, you can get a variety of chicken sandwiches, a turkey burger, lamb burger, veggie or buffalo burger. Dotty's also has salads, chili and soup, ahi tuna steak, portabella mushroom sammy, fish sandwiches, brats, corn dogs, and did I mention Spotted Cow?

Friendly and attentive service is standard and be prepared to wait a long time on game days.  However, you can't miss going to Dotty's for a real Wisconsin bar experience. Beautiful wood paneling throughout, a great long wood bar and lots of Wisconsin memorabilia line the walls. The bar just has a great feel to it without being forced.  I am so glad Dotty's opened back up several years ago after closing for 3 years just after I started school in Madison. Can't wait to go back!

Awesome!  Best burger I have had in a long time.  My wife gives two thumbs up for the vegetarian selections.  The service is top notch.  We came in with our two girls in the Burley stroller and they made every accommodation for us.  The waitress was very patient with the girls who had a ton of questions.  We can't wait to come back!!!

The best burger and cheese curds I have ever had. I was in town for the weekend and ate at this place twice. Can be a wait at certain times, but it is worth it. The food is fresh and prepared how you want it.  They have a good menu for pub food lovers. Staff is very friendly and  food comes out pretty quick. If you are in Madison this is a must try.

Don't be fooled by the name. Great burgers (the menu is a la carte). The place is charming with the wood booth seats. We had the toadstool and the Mediterranean lamb burgers. The lamb burger was great ;)
one of the better places in madison. great beer selection. burger and onion rings were good

From the rave reviews, I gave this place a try. I ordered a bison burger and truffle fries. The burger overall was quite bland. The meat and special sauce lacked flavor. The soft brioche-like buns were the only good thing about it. The truffle fries barely had any truffle taste and the cheese was just a sprinkle. Green onions and smoked bacon were a plus. Im not sure what the hype is. I come from the west coast known for great burgers. Overall disappointing.
People say best burgers around, totally misleading statement. Food was ok, nothing above and beyond.

We had the most wonderful experience at this authentic Wisconsin pub & restaurant. Rarely do you find a place where the atmosphere, the food  and the staff all are excellent! If you are ever in Madison, WI this place is worth a trip. The neighborhood is a little busy. But it is worth it. 

We had Sage as our server, she was very friendly and helpful.

Here is a little tip, there is a parking garage just North of the restaurant on Francis St.

Possibly the best burgers in Madison -- juicy, decadent, cheese-tastic.  Great service, huge baskets of fries, and obscure old movies on the TVs.  What's not to like?  Well, maybe the parking situation, but the parking garage across the street generally provides paid spots.

Mmmm, Dowry burgers.  These are some of the best burgers I've ever had.  The only reason it gets 4 stars instead of 5 is that no sides are included in the price.  It's not like some fries or a side salad on a $6-8 burger would break the bank, guys.

Also, *excellent* drink special on Thursdays.
The BEST veggie burger I have ever had. Dottys is a must eat if you want a good American style restaurant! Curds are also amazing ;-)

I've been coming to Dotty's since it was a hole in the wall where you could get a giant burger and fries for under $5.

It was ranked one of the top burgers 10 burgers in the country.  I have traveled extensively, Dotty's is my #1.  To the gentleman who said he had better burgers in DC, please tell me where?  I didnt find anything half this good when I lived there.

If you havent eaten here before, make your first burger the Melting Pot.  I get mine with lettuce, tomato, fried onions, and extra garlic sauce.  After that you may want to try some of the many other options, but make this one your first.

If you like cheese curds, or even if you dont, get the cheese curds, with garlic sauce for dipping.  Best cheese curds I've found outside of a state fair.

Fried Mac & Cheese Wedges are another favorite.  You can get a basket of fries to share with 2-4 people, and you can make them chilli cheese fries which are awesome.  The malteds are great.  I've heard the pie and drinks on tap are great, although I havent tried either.

The prices have steadily gone up in the decades I've been a patron, and it's harder and harder to find parking, or get quick takeout.  These days I only go when I plan to sit down.  The atmosphere is excellent and they almost always have really good music playing, often of very random genres.

If you're like me and are on a mission to know where all the good burgers are, here are my other local stops:  Player's Bar & Grill on Winnebago.  Not quite as much flavor as Dotty's, but damn it's an impressive hunk of meat.  Weary Traveler on Williamson.  Everything here is excellent and many swear by the burger.  Grumpy Troll in Mt Horeb, personally this isnt one of my favorites but their burgers are renowned and I will eat one if I'm there.  And Five Guys.  Chain nonwithstanding, if you dont love Five Guys, I dont trust you on burgers.

Oh I forgot to mention-- Village Bar on Mineral Point was picked by the Food Network as one of the top burgers in country.  I tried one and couldnt have been more disappointed.  It was tiny and flavorless, like a cafeteria burger.  I did enjoy their smoked sausage sandwich and it's a great little spot.

Two words: BISON BURGER.

I could just end my review there, to be honest. That's really all you need to know. However, if I must go on, let me say that the fries here are pretty banging too and I love the old timey movies playing (The Manchurian Candidate was on when my mom and I were there).

The new location is a bit dark and very pub-y, but has a good, casual ambiance full of wooden booths and friendly servers. Nothing fancy here - come for a casual dining experience and enjoy a plethora of burger options (including veggie burgers for all your vegan and vegetarians out there). For you carnivores, again: get the BISON BURGER and call it a day. You will thank me later!

Have been to Dotty's a few times now and it is definitely the place I go when craving a burger.  It's rare to find a place that actually cooks your burger the way it's ordered, but Dotty's does just that every.single.time.  Great combinations too.  

Service... excellent every single time too.

AMAZING! My husband and I are here for a short visit from Alabama and we dropped into Dotty Dumpling's Dowry and I'm so incredibly glad we did! The cheese curds were to die for, my Green and Gold burger was perfection, and I want to take all their pickles home with me. 

Sage was our server and she is INCREDIBLE! If you go to Dotty's, ask to sit with Sage - I know I will when we come back on our next trip!

Whoever married Dotty Dumpling better like burgers.  What is there not to like?  Judging from most reviews not a thing.  So I checked this place out and had one of the best tasting burgers I have ever had. 
Mine was the Melting Pot burger with an absolutely delicious garlic sauce.  No catsup or mustard needed unless you so desire.   The Grand Daddy burger was delicious too according to someone else in my group.
I would say the burger was better than a great burger.  It had something special due to its great combination of flavor, juiciness, delicious cheese and cooked perfectly.  Our service was perfect, not too little and not too much.  The place is a bit dark inside.  Might be nice for a date but to me it felt a bit too dingy.  Entire staff was professional.  The bathroom was very clean.  So nice to see this.  Open kitchen is nice.  Second time I saw this this week and I think it really gives people a sense of what goes on in the kitchen isn't being hidden behind the wall.
As I go back for more I suspect this place will move up to 5 stars.  Don't let me down Dotty.

The good:
1. My burger was delicious and there were lots of interesting options.  My burger was juicy, perfectly cooked to order and had great, fresh toppings. You can smell the charbroiled flavor the minute you walk in. My mouth was watering as soon as I stepped through the doorway. 

The bad:
