1. I had the most popular burger- the Melting pot. It had three pieces of cheese that didn't totally melt and bacon which I didn't taste because the burger flavor was overpowering. 
2. I realize we were in Wisconsin,land of beer, but a more extensive wine list would have been nice. 

The verdict: keep it simple and go for a plain cheeseburger and beer. It won't disappoint.

Buffalo burger and the cheese curds were amazing. We had really great service as well. We were recommended this place by the hotel we were staying at, definitely a good place to stop by when you are in the area!

Best burger in Madison hands down! I always get the Melting Pot. There's a reason it is their most sold burger. Oh, and it is topped with bacon, so there's that. The burgers are big. Call me a wimp, but I always ask for a knife so I can cut mine in half.

If you get fries, get a basket to share amongst yourselves. Unfortunately the burgers do not come with fries. There is malt vinegar on the table to make your fries English style...always a plus

Warning: Do not come here on a night that there is a sporting event at the Kohl Center. Or, if you do, be prepared to wait.
Dotty's is home to the best burgers in Madison.  They also have a pretty solid selection of beers on tap and good sides.
I've enjoyed Dotty's every time I've been there.  Love their Black and Bleu burger, and they've got decent beer selection.  Never had any problem with the service.  Yay! I'm a fan.

Oh, it's been a while, Triple D.

Before they moved, DDD was on State Street and there was a kayak that hung over your head.  It was hard to enjoy your burgers with that kayak there because I was so sure the rigging would snap and the kayak would hit me mid-burger bite.

Seems like the kayak was put into storage for the North Frances location.  We split Friday fish fry and the California burger, hold the sprouts.  Both were delicious and warm and made me forget about the cold that awaited outside.  There was lots of cool UW memorabilia inside and it made me swoon nostalgic for my college days.  There were lots of cozy booths and everyone seemed to be genuinely enjoying themselves for a late night dinner.  Really good, chill crowd.

On a sidenote, I needed to charge my phone while we were having dinner and the hostess complied with my request.  She seemed like a totally normal girl but was totally awkward with an adult speaking to her.  Ahhh, what it's like to be an awkward college student who can't fathom what 25 will look or feel like.  Ignorance really is bliss.

Still the same great food I remember from a decade plus ago. The curds are the best I have ever found and the burgers are right there as well. Service is always friendly and the prices are quite affordable. If you are looking to get yo drank on, you can do that here as well. Definitely recommend a stop if you find yourself in the area.

This place is purty damn good if you're looking for a tasty burger/ some mouthwatering fried goods! Cheese curds are out of this world and I'm adding them to my top 3 in Madison list (currently consisting of these, the Nitty and Roast, but very subject to change). I like the dark mood lighting and the old school UW feel here! Bring your fam, bring your friends, most importantly bring your appetite!
One of the better burger places I've been to. I looked the ambiance with almost a speak easy feel.

Whenever I'm in Madison I have to eat at Dotty Dumplings Dowry!  There's usually a wait but, the wait is worth in.  Starting with the hostess, it was super busy today but, the hostess was calm and smiling.  She kept tellung us thank you for waiting and she was sorry for the wait.  She told us our wait would be 50mins and we was seated and had placed our order within that time.    We had the pleasure of having the lovely Nichole as our server.  Nichole was awesome!  She was friendly, smiling, and her food suggestions was a big help!  You want regret eating there!  Enjoy!!

Wow! The Bayou (turkey) burger was fantastic!! I don't know how they made the perfect balance of mayo, cheese, and other toppings, but they did. It was perfectly proportioned not overly filling and very satisfying meal. Great list of beers to boot!

Loved the atmosphere. Our waitress was nice! Didn't think it was the best burger I had though. My sister loved their garlic mayo and it reminded her of the garlic mayo she was served with fish in Ireland. Cheese curds were great too! Strong drinks too :)
awesome burgers,local craft beers, and good curds. if you want at least one of those you wont be disappointed here.

Great burgers -- strict rules. 

Check whether there is an event at the Kohl Center -- or a Wisconsin game on TV --  before trying to grab dinner at Dotty's. They enforce an hour-limit per table, which isn't that big of a deal (especially if you don't care about said game) except that they're pushy about it. The host will tell you. The server will tell you. There's a sign on the table. We get it - leave after an hour. 

Also, our server told us on our last visit: no split tickets. This is one of my restaurant pet peeves considering the computer system is almost always capable of doing this work automatically. And lest you forget, your 60 minutes are ticking away while you figure out the bill. 

Conclusion: You'll have great food at Dotty's, but go here for a quick bite with a small group (preferably  on the same ticket) on a non-game night.
Crazy good burgers! If yer not afraid of rich, cheesy-mayo decadence get yerself a melting pot.

Dotty's obviously doesn't need my review, but I'm adding it anyway! I recently visited during my first ever trip to Madison, and was instantly hooked. The fried cheese curds (a first for this East coast guy) were amazing, and the locals I was with mentioned that Dotty's were - in their opinion - the best in town. 

A great selection of burgers, including buffalo and vegetarian options. I had the California burger with sprouts and guacamole, and unlike a lot of burger joints, the darn thing was actually cooked properly! When they said pink through the middle, they meant it. Halfway through the meal I stopped caring how messy I was getting. Oh, and as an added bonus, the service was friendly and reasonably prompt. I hope to be back one day....!

After living in the Bay Area for nearly four years, and visiting several delicious burger joints, I was a little skeptic of my fond memories of delicious burgers from Dotty Dumpling's. It turns out, however, that Dotty Dumpling's still serves up some of the best burgers I've ever had.

On my last visit a few days ago, I ordered the Californian, my boyfriend got the newest addition, the Heart Throb, and we both had a beer. My Californian was so, so delicious. The burger was perfectly cooked to medium, and it had the best beefy taste I've come across in awhile. I also liked how the cold ingredients were piled on the bottom, and the burger, bacon and cheese on top; I think it helps the cheese melt better.

I had a small taste of the spicy sauce from my boyfriend's Heart Throb. From the taste of it, the sauce had jalapeno, cilantro and lime. I'm sure when paired with the cheese (pepper-jack, I believe) and bacon, that made for one delicious burger...I kinda wish that I would have ordered that one!

If you're a fan of burgers, stop by Dotty Dumpling's. You won't be disappointed.

Great beer. Loved the Huron Brewing Company and the Cowgirl's salad. Cheese curds were phenomenal!! My Dad's burger was a bit overdone and on the menu, it specifically said they always keep a little pink in the middle and it was pretty cooked through. But overall, great atmosphere, friendly staff, little to no wait. Would come back!

Nice burgers with options for everybody. Bun was soft, but held up nicely. I chose the Melting Pot and tasted great, but I've had better burgers in places like Five Guys.

They sell themselves as the Hamburguers HQ of the world, which is catchy.

The place is great to hangout with friends, have a couple of beers, etc.... expect long lines....

Fun traditional burger joint to chow down at before a Badger basketball or hockey game! Their curds are excellent and have a tap beer menu that most Wisconsinites would be proud of. A slew of burgers and sandwich options to order from. Also, the atmosphere is a little darker with a lot of nick nacks and photos co wrong the walls.

I was blown away by the burgers! I got the Heart Throb  and my son got the Grand Daddy. I thought the Heart Throb was pretty amazing until my son let me try a bite of the Grand Daddy. I cannot proper explain how delicious, rich, and flavorful that burger was. Consider my mind blown! We also had the chili cheese fries and fried pickles. The chili on the fries was really good with big chunks of tender beef. Plan on sharing and it's a huge order!

I was tricked into coming here.  This place serves burgers and pretty much nothing else.  They offer a home-made vegan patty on the menu, but it turns out there are no vegan buns.  The waitress was kind enough to offer to put the patty on top of a couple pieces of lettuce, which is slightly better than what we've experience some other places.  But, if you are serious about trying to cater to us dietary weirdos, please go the extra step and save a spot in your freezer for a couple frozen vegan buns from Whole Foods.  You can them pop in the oven for 8 minutes on the rare occasion a vegan actual tries to partake of your otherwise flavorful offerings.
You won't be disappointed by the food here. Everything will taste solid and they have a decent selection of interesting food for those who want to try something different.

Any place that has a charcoal grill will win me over! On top of that, Dottys has such a wide variety of burgers and toppings that there is something for everyone. The sides range from
fantastic to amazing, guaranteed to satisfy any craving! For dessert I love a good strawberry shake which they make with chocolate shoppe ice cream on an old fashion spindle so they are nice and thick! You can really tell that the staff enjoys working there and it's fun to see the open kitchen while your meal is prepared!!! 

A must eat place!

Dotty's is excellent burger joint in Madison! I had the Melting Pot which is a burger with bacon, three types of cheese and a special sauce. It was delicious! I have only gone there before Badger Games at the Kohl Center and on those days, it is extremely crowded. They are not a huge restaurant so get there early because most people stay till just before game time. I also had a Bloody Mary but I wasn't a huge fan of the Tomato juice mix and the seasoning. Overall, I would and plan to go back for the food. If you are looking for some of the best burgers and other fried foods in Madison, try Dotty's!

It kills me to give this place two stars, because I want to love it so, so badly.  WHY DO YOU MAKE IT SO HARD FOR ME TO LOVE YOU, DDD?  

Let's start with the good.  I love the beer selection here, I love that you can get Ale Asylum Pantheon consistently, and the fries are fantastic.  Burgers are good.  Good selection, generally good execution.  Cheese curds are above average.

However.

It seems like every time we come here, there's an issue, and it's usually with the burger buns.  Specifically, they come out partially frozen, and if you send them back, they come out partially frozen.  This has happened a number of times in a row, and seems to be more frequent with the veggie burger that my wife orders.  I think, of all the times we've come here, I've been able to eat at the same time as my wife exactly once due to some issue.  We're not relentless customizers or anything, it's just the same issue over and over.

I've been sticking to things with animal products in them, and the buns are mostly fine, though the frozen bun thing has happened once or twice to me as well.  That said, the non-burger sandwiches aren't anything special.

I usually give places a pretty long leash, but there are better options closer to home that don't require parking around campus, and are a safer bet in terms of consistency.  I can go to Vintage Brewing, it's a mile from my house, they have their own parking lot, and my food there is never frozen.

Just based on the name, who doesn't want to spend at least one of their evenings at Dotty Dumplings?

Not only was the name intriguing, but the great reviews on Yelp and its proximity to our hotel made it an easy choice for dinner on our last night in. That, and we hadn't *quite* met our quota of cheese curds and these were allegedly a delicious option.

They are, in fact, a delicious option. So try them. But when you do, keep in mind that the portions of everything are GIGANTIC. We made the mistake of order two sides in addition to our entrees, and let's just say there were some pissed off starving children in Africa that night. Two people could easily eat the (delicious) chili cheese fries as an entire meal. 

Bringing me, naturally, to the chili. Which had excellent flavor and spice. More importantly, the meat they use is obviously well cooked and a high quality--it's not your standard ground beef but rather a stew-type meat that falls apart in your mouth. You could put it on a grasshopper and I'd be willing to eat it. The burgers are juicy and delicious, and their caesar salad was huge, fresh, and really flavorful. Their beer list is, as in much of Madison, locally-based, quite large, and with a lot of delicious options.

The service was okay, and either our waitress was very forgetful or completely in the weeds. But at least she was friendly! 

So even if you can't say the name five times fast (or even really remember where it is you're eating), you should probably wander over here at some point. But, beware, if you order as much as we did you're going to have some seriously ticked starving children to answer to.
Have tried many burger places in town and this place has the best burgers! We love eating here. Their burgers that have cream cheese on them are delicious! Definitely give this place a try!

Why is this called "Dotty Dumpling's Dowry" when pretty much all they have are burgers?  Well, they're good burgers.

I got a special which included Hook's Blue Cheese and caramelized onions.  While I personally would have liked to have had more cheese, they burger was good, overall.  The fries were nicely salted and the right crispiness for my liking.  They have a pretty great beer list too!

Super tasty spot!  My fiancé and I were in Madison for a football game, and a lot of people recommended this place to us.  The wait was kind of long, but we got some drinks and chilled for about 45 minutes until our table was ready.  Once we were seated, we loved the cheese curds and the burgers we ordered.  The cheese on them was especially delicious--thanks, Wisconsin!
very tasty and interesting burgers.  I like the basil burger the best.  Very nice for an intimate place with american style burgers.  Probably the classiest burger joint I've been to
Awesome burgers, sweet potato fries and chocolate shake.  We had the melting pot burger which is rated best burger and it lived up to the rating!  Service was prompt with our order.

I'm a longtime fan of Dotty's. The service is consistent, the decor is always interesting including old movies playing on the TVs, which is fun, and the food is just yummy, happy, satisfying goodness. The Melting Pot and the Runnelstone are my 2 top picks for burgers. The Melting Pot comes with 3 kinds of cheese (cheddar, Swiss  & provolone) and thick, gorgeous bacon. The Runnelstone has cheddar and caramelized onions. And the English garlic sauce on both is a mayo lovers dream - SO GOOD on pretty much anything! Oh and the cheese curds.........some of the best in the city with a nice ranch dipping sauce. I've always been curious about their Bloody Mary, but have yet to give that a try. Stop into Dotty's when you have a major burger hankering - you'll be super happy you did!

The crowds here are a good sign. I've had the spicy black bean veggie burger, vegan burger, and fried cod sandwich. All are delicious.

I'm docking one star because I really think the burgers/sandwiches should come with at least a small side (a few fries? some steamed broccoli?). I've always found a burger/sandwich on its own leaves something to be desired, but ordering a side to go with it is too much food/too pricey. I usually split an order of cheese curds with whoever I'm with, and those usually hit the spot.

Food: 4
Service: 3
Uniqueness: 4

----------------------------------------------------------------
Being so close to the Kohl Center, this place can get really busy and the service can take a hit. If you're in the area, try it for lunch on a non-gameday.

Dotty's is a Madison legend. The food here isn't pretentious or super unique, it's just deliciously prepared with a lot of fried stuff. The fried mac and cheese bites and the fried mushrooms are must haves for me. They come with an excellent garlic dipping sauce that will blow your mind. The burgers are awesome because you can totally customize them to what you want. 

If you haven't tried bison before, definitely give it a shot here as it's one of the only places that offers it as a choice. It's got a different flavor and is leaner than beef but it's really tasty.

It had a large variety of burgers, good beer selection, crispy fries, and a fun atmosphere. The burgers did not come with a side of fries. It did NOT however have dumplings, instead mainly burgers. I would come back here again.

Food: They have good beer flights if you want to sample a bunch of the local brews. I started things off with the Wisco Road Trip. Then for my meal, I ordered the Melting Pot Burger. It came with Cheddar, Swiss, and Provolone cheese, Jones Diary Farm smoked bacon, and their signature English garlic sauce. I can definitely see and taste why it's their number one selling burger! I finished things off with the Mad City Flight.

Service: I received excellent service. The waitress always checked up on me. Not once did I feel neglected. I even had a booth all to myself.

Overall: I've eaten my fair share of burgers and the one I had here easily ranks at the top. I would definitely want to come back here to try other items on their menu.

Food ok. Service consistently poor to awful. Lighting painfully low. 

Specialty burger restaurant whose burger patties are only ok - today dry, rubbery, fairly flavourless though previously better - and flavour combinations pretty mediocre. Assorted deep fried foods are pretty good including the very expensive cheese curds. I had the toadstool burger. The mushrooms and cheese faded away against the charred flavour of the patty which was slightly pink inside and black on the outside. The bun was soggy. The garlic sauce remarkably tasty. For $7.50 ish I felt ripped off. Would recommend getting a cheeseburger to go from five guys to be honest!

Service has been poor on previous visits and today was especially bad. "Emily" took her time before she finally came by our table. Then she asked us for our drink orders three times in the space of two minutes. Then a five minute gap... When I said we were ready to order she inexplicably turned around, walked off and disappeared for another five minutes. The rest of the service was adequate in a surly teenage kinda way though she also failed to mention that the cider on the menu was listed incorrectly. When it arrived it was actually peach flavoured and not to my taste at all. However I couldn't be bothered wrestling with her further so can't really blame the restaurant entirely for having suffered through an entire glass of the stuff. 

Overall, we will not be returning. Between the dingy lighting (I think meant to create atmosphere...?!!!), the mediocre, overpriced food and the appalling service I would recommend you go elsewhere too.

Time has not treated you well, Dotty.  Almost 20 years ago in college (god that sounds that a long time ago), I visited Dotty's when it was located on Regent St.  A small place that delivered an absolutely amazing burger.  I still remember it to this day.  Fast forward to today and Dotty's is not even close to what it once was.  Yes, it still carries a strong brand recognition in Madison but let's face it, the burger scene in Madison is hyper competitive and there are at least 7 other places that produce a superior sandwich.  Way too much sauce, the meat lacked flavor and didn't appear to be hand pattied the way they once were. What once was is now very pedestrian and unerwhelming.  Sure, they will attract the people that stroll by on their way to a Kohl Center event but won't be attracting me anytime soon.
Still the go to burger place in Madison!   Cooked to order and the sauces make the difference. Cheese curds are some of the best as well. Order the English garlic sauce as a side.

After browsing the Yelp reviews for the best lunch and burgers, I convinced my extended family to dine here for lunch. I was really excited and knew I would order the Melting Pot burger. 

The short review is that it just isn't that good. I'll confess to being a foodie and probably a borderline burger critic. So with that said, I'm not saying that Dotty's doesn't have great burgers or service. What I am saying is that I've had better tasting burgers. I think that their menu items have potential but that there are things they could do to elevate my taste buds.

Now, for the long review. We ordered cheese curds for the table. These were pretty good but over-cooked. The batter was tasty and not too heavy. But since they were overcooked we were left with a lot of cheesey batter bites rather than cheese curds. The ranch dressing/dip they were served with was delicious (and upon asking for more, we were notified we'd be charged for it). 

I ordered the Melting Pot burger (3 kinds of cheese, garlic mayo, bacon, I added tomato and lettuce). It was just fine (however the rest of my party was satisfied probably because they frequent WI burger places and I frequent DC burger places).  More details: Unless you otherwise specify, all burgers are served medium. My burger was medium, so hooray! The meat itself was good but was a bit bland. Spice it up a bit! (I'm guessing the oil or whatever they cook them in overwhelms the beef). The three cheeses were piled on each other and weren't melted entirely. The garlic mayo (called garlic sauce) was not that garlic-y. And as for the bacon, I could barely taste it and I'm not even kidding you! So maybe the bacon was under-cooked? Either way, it should stand out somewhat. The bun, was lovely!! Light, fluffy and the flavor was complimentary to the burger. However, if you order your burger and it sits for a while, it could get soggy.

So overall, it was fine. If this place is convenient, go there! Everything was reasonably priced and their beer menu features 89% locally brewed beer (super great!). Fries/sides are a la carte but you can easily eat a burger, add fries and have a beer for $15. The service we received was great!  But if you eat a lot of burgers, this place will just leave you searching for a better one with better ingredients. 

Also, if you drive here, there is street parking available and there are two parking ramps, on is on Francis and Johnson St, the other is across University, on Francis, past Wandos & the Red Barn. If the one on Francis and Johnson is full, try the other one and find it by passing Wandos, and turning left before you run into the dead end.

My only lament about Dotty Dumpling's is that they stopped serving the ostrich burger before I got to try it. Woe.

Other than that--I don't know what else I can say other than: Best. Burgers. Evar.

I got their "famous" multi cheese burger. From the description I expected it to be a bit more cheesy. Didn't appreciate that the up charge for sweet potato fries was almost 3 dollars. Their ranch dressing (I'm a ranchaholic) was off putting... It tasted like they had dumped massive amounts of rosemary in it. 
The buyer I ordered medium and came medium rare almost on the line of rare. I like that, but my father and mother were very unhappy. The decor is nice and the staff was friendly. The beer I had was delicious... But for the good we received... The prices were pretty unrealistic. Wouldn't recommend it or go back.

The good: Everything. Seriously though, from the delicious cheese curds to the vanilla and fudge pie we were practically licking the plates. My husband got the melting pot burger and it was incredible-the cheese was all melted and gooey and paired with the bacon and patty perfectly. I had the mozzarella basil and it was melt in your mouth-I especially loved the red pepper aioli. 

You need to ask for Nicole to be your waitress-she is exceptional. 

The bad: nothing-you won't be disappointed

This place makes a mean burger.  There are a ton to choose from, too.  They put all kinds of different sauces on them, which I appreciate as a real sauce-guy.  You really can't go wrong, I've been here a few times and had a tasty burger every single time.  If you're in Madison and love burgers, you gotta go here.

If you don't love burgers... you may still want to go here.  I recently tried the wings and cheese curds - both of which are pretty dang good.  The curds have a light batter to them.  Not quite Old Fashioned good, but definitely tasty.  Also, their chili was excellent and so were the chicken wings.  This place can do no wrong!

At first I was kinda pissed that fries weren't included with a burger but then I reminded myself that the burgers cost 8-10 bucks not 12-14 and the fries are only 2 dollars. It's actually kind of nice for people like my mother who have smaller appetites and would rather steal a few from everybody else than get all her own and not be able to finish them

The melting pot burger is a meme, try something else. The onion rings are a must for me

It's more like 1.5 $ because you can just get a burger and get out of there for 10 bucks, though I will concede I never do

Probably the best cheese curds in Madison. Very small but the breading was perfect. I ordered a burger and so did my friend. We both enjoyed our meals and had a great time. Our server was friendly and checked up on us regularly. We asked some questions about the food and she was very knowledgeable and happy to answer us. Kind of an older-looking place but it is well kept and nice.

Just had lunch here for the first time. Ditto to all the other great reviews. Very friendly staff. Sad waited on me. She was very attentive, without being overly bothersome. She offered to assist me with the menu, since I said I had never been here before. While I love the interesting menus, I ordered a build your own burger and just had an old school burger with lettuce, tomato, pickles, and extra raw onions. It was perfectly cooked to medium. Regular fries were hot and crispy. I got a side of the garlic sauce to have with the fries. Delicious! Will definitely come back. Very casual and interesting decor. Overall, a great experience.
Everything here is delicious! Best burgers around!! The cheesecurds are perfection! I used to love Old Fashioned cheesecurds, but they are way too greasy. Dotty's curds are my new fav!

Let me tell you a little tale of glory and hamburgers. I was confronted with a decision this evening to have a great burger or to tailgate a little league game with Alec Baldwin. So I chose the burger. I looked up a good burger in Wisconsin and it showed me to this gaping hole in the wall "Dotty Dumpling Dowry" but it should be called the ice box. It was so cold I was served ice cream even though I ordered hot cocoa. My nips were on mega blast this evening. I had a hard time ordering because my waitress could stop staring at the baby carrots I was smuggling under my shirt. Pack a jacket or at least skin a yak before you walk in. Anyways, the cheese curds were squeaky and good. I had the Melting Pot burger. That was some quality slaughtered beef. I mean it was juicy and had a great meaty slaughtered taste. The bun was soft and was on a mission to transport that slaughtered meat patty to my tooth garage. 

Top sum it all up. I think that we need to look at cars differently. They are just the craziest things ever. I mean, are they even organic?

Great burgers and ambiance, but let down by soggy French fries, though a later lunch there (OK, I admit it, ti was the very next day!) had OK fries. Not great, but OK.
Bratwurst was also well worth a try.

We were driving from Minneapolis home to Chicago and wanted some place to eat that wasn't some fast food place along the highway. A quick google search for "good burgers in Madison" led us to this place. We loved it. Best cheese curds I've ever had, and my burger was really, really good. I'll make a point of stopping in next time I'm within 50 miles.

Good food but service has been a problem for me consistently over the last ten or so years. My first experience involved me ordering a burger well done, being served a rare burger, sending it back and saying, "I don't mind if you put it in the microwave" and being brought back a medium-rare burger, then giving up after eating the outer edges and not coming back for almost a decade. 

More recent visits have improved on the kitchen front - I dig their fries and usually opt for their staff favorite Green & Gold burger - cheddar, deep fried pickles, and bacon mayonnaise. A heart attack on a plate to be sure, but what a way to go. 

The service, though, continues to be lackluster. We've been left for an entire meal without anyone checking on us and having to literally get up and walk to the host station to get someone to bring us a bill, we've had servers that seem distracted and like we're a burden for placing an order, and on one occasion had a server that couldn't be bothered to check on us but could stand next to our table talking to another server for a good ten minutes. Oy. 

We don't go often so when the mood strikes us I'm usually willing to overlook past service and hope for better. No luck so far, but I'm holding out hope we'll get someone who enjoys their job eventually.
Our daughters loved Dotty's so much they requested to eat here twice on our trip to Madison! Loved it! Can't wait to go back one day!

Went here for lunch on a weekday. The service was good. The burgers were huge and delicious. The fries were hot and fresh. I had an iced tea the server kept full. We didn't have a wait before being seated. The server was very friendly. I liked the decor and atmosphere.
First visit was last night.  Why did I wait so long to find this place?  Burgers are made the way the are supposed to be....truly.  Very good service and ambience.

I think this was the fastest I've ever ate a hamburger in my entire life. And was the greatest tasting, which begs the udder question:

HOW DO YOU RAISE YOUR COWS OUT THERE IN WISCONSIN?!

Almost 5 stars, but the service was spotty. 

Ok our food was delicious from start to finish. As others have noted, the cheese curds are outstanding, not greasy like most places. The wings were also excellent, big and plump. 

The burgers of course were fantastic, each of the 4 of us tried a different one and they were all great, not a morsel left by the end of the meal, and we were stuffed and happy. 

Go here.

Great burgers. I feel like a great burger requires two things: for the actual patty to be tasty and cooked appropriately, and for the variations on the general burger to be interesting. The patties are fantastic at Dotty Dumplings-- theyre not too heaped up and the mediums are cooked pink and warm in the center. The variations are also fantastic: the Heart Throb is my favorite but there are a number of other interesting options as well. Fries are delicious, fried mac and cheese also great. Haven't tried the curds (I feel like I'm missing out).

And the ambiance is easy going and friendly. Overall, I'm a fan. A definitely solid spot to grab a burger when youre in the peri-downtown area.

I remember my burger being better. 

Picture this: it's 200x and my first visit to DDD. Old college classmate (she was like 2 years ahead of me) led me here. It was more impressive to find an alum from my school at this place, UW so I trusted she knew the what what. 

Well, then...the burger was everything I desired. SLOPPY, BIG, JUICY AND FLAVORFUL. 
Yesterday, the Melting Pot was just "Eh" ala  The Simpsons. 
The cheese hadn't really melted on top. 
The meat was prepared just right and I was scared to death that a WELL done patty would be burnt to a crisp. The server was a sweetheart that was just as nervous and offered to take it back if anything was wrong. NOPE! So those guys know what they're doing around the grill. 

The standard English Garlic was nuked in favor of my highly anticipated HEART THROB sauce. The man that came up with this ~ can come home with me :* Mwah!

We shared a fry. The deal of the day sound impressive which my colleague ordered and it's a FANTASTIC VALUE. A $10-12 burger+fries+drink for only $9.99. 

I forewarned him that I, as a lady, have proper dining manners BUT all would be foregone for this anticipated burger. He laughed and said he was about to tell me that because he was going to be embarrassed in front of me (then he blushed). ROTFL. 

Maybe I hyped this burger up too much. Maybe I couldn't recall that initial burger I had years ago - either way. It was fresh - kudos. 
Sauce was 4.25star worthy - would have gotten 5 stars if they glob it on there for me
Patty - 4 stars
Overall taste - 3 stars. 
Decor - remains the same but not a winning point to me - 2stars
Open Grill and visable to us all - 4 stars  ( I almost forgot that one)
Pricing + Comparison as soo many good burgers exist in madison and I don't mean Red Robin - 2 stars. 

My weighted overall response: 3 stars. This is a solid place. Decent appeal and service. Excellent possibilities but for this lady - yesterday was just "ok."

This place a great burgers and their house made fried cheese curds were amazing. My only problem was that they forgot to put bacon on my friends chicken wrap. The server did go to the kitchen and get us a big handful after we told him, but the kitchen should not have made a mistake like that. Not when you're paying over $10 for a sandwich. 

I will still go back and give them another chance. Please just don't forget something next time.

I decided to try out Dotty Dumpling's Dowry because I was told they had good burgers and who am I kidding - I like good burgers.  I got the Melting Pot Burger.  Wasn't great as everyone raved....so I was a bit disappointed given the hype about this place and their burgers.  The only thing I enjoyed was a side of cheese curds. Not sure if I will be returning next time I am in Madison.

This is my second trip here...amazing burgers!   The quality and the toppings are so good.  I love my business trips to Madison. 

Outside you will find an ordinary building (nothing special) with a line waiting outside...but inside it is a beautiful bar and restuarant.  If you are by yourself, then go past the line and squeeze in at the bar.  Don't ask the last guy in line outside because he never knows anything.  Those are words to live by!!!

Today I built my own burger and I was so happy...perfectly cooked medium rare...if you serve burgers you need to make sure they are not over cooked and this place does an amazing job.  

Great micro brews on tap.  Happy Hour also rocks...half off all tap beer from 4-6pm but I've never had the chance to enjoy it because I'm usually working at that time.  Makes me sad I'm paying full price right now. 

When in Madison, I highly recommend this place for some burgers and Beer.  The Onion Rings are also good too!!!

Good burgers, great curds and fried pickles, lots of retro and classic drink options. Close to the Kohl Center, so expect long waits and slow service after game days or for weekend dinners. Nonetheless, it's a good stop for a quick bite to eat for the family and a classic Wisconsin food experience.
Delicious food.  Fun atmosphere.  Every time I have been here I have enjoyed it. I take guests from out of town here because it's consistently excellent and they always love it.  Don't miss it!

Tried the melting pot burger and coleslaw. Burger was amazing. Highly recommend .  The coleslaw was creamy and awesome. 
Inside of restaurant was pretty interesting also. All together a great place.

The food is always good. The service is rough. We had a group of 9 and one burger was completely forgotten. Two burgers were undercooked. A soup never came. When we told our server that the burger was undercook she took it to have it remade. The manager (I'm assuming) brought it back two minutes later with her phone and turned the flashlight on to show us that the cook on the burger was correct. My friend still asked for it to be recooked because she felt that it was under. The entire table felt that it was rude the way the manager approached that situation. In the end, burgers and other items were comped and free pie was given which was nice but it wasn't enough. We will definitely be taking a break from Dotty's after this experience.
Yummy food! Mac and Cheese wedges accompanied with the Moon Man beer is an amazing combo! Their green and gold and runnelstone burgers were cooked to perfection!

Despite having "dumpling" in their name, they do not have dumplings on their menu and it's really quite confusing for people who have never been there. However, they have a drool-worthy menu full of burgers.

Aside from the sign informing patrons that they are discouraged to stay for more than an hour when it's busy, I had a great time at DDD. The service was really on point because I went there with my boyfriend on Badger game day. I had the Runnelstone and he had the Toadstool. We also ordered a basket of fries. I wanted my burger medium rare with raw onions instead of grilled and that is exactly what I got. It was delicious and aside from the bun feeling a little flimsy was exactly everything I look for in a burger. Juicy, flavorful patty with slightly melted cheese and plenty of onion. The fries were also perfect. Slight crisp on the outside with just the right amount of salt. 

I am totally in love with their burgers and might try to eat my way through their menu. Wish me luck.

Last Saturday was the only time in my life when I used the word "F**K" and "Dumplings" in the same sentence(As in "F**K no I do not want to go to Dotty Dumpling's").  My ever observant companions  took that as a definite NO and fortunately we went elsewhere.

Is it just me? Do I not know what a good burger tastes like or what good service consists of? After reading the good reviews here  guess I don't but the two times I have been there in three years I have had the most greasy, overpriced burgers accompanied by slow, indifferent service I have ever had.  I ordered a medium-rare and got a bloody, greasy glob that pretty much dissolved the bun. The meat was tasteless and the only thing that saved it was the sauce. Oh, and it took a mere forty-five minutes to get to me. The first visit wasn't much better.
 I think though that it may have something to do with going there on Sunday nights which can be a crap-shoot at any restaurant in Madison. Maybe I'll try it again on a weekday but since I had one of  the worst meals of my LIFE at this place I'm not eager to test my luck again.
If you have to go, stick to the fried mushrooms.

Highlights of a weekday lunch were the delicious, house-made veggie burger, the offering of local brews and spirits and the quick service at the bar.  I hadn't been here in years and was a bit surprised at the high prices on the menu - especially since none of the burgers/sammies include a side; fries, etc are an extra cost. A regular order of fries is enough (but just barely) for two people.  And food is served in baskets which made eating kind of awkward.
Great burgers and tasty beers on the menu here. A Madison staple. Get the English Garlic sauce on the side for dipping those awesome cheese curds - they are the best I've ever had!

This is an always busy burger joint.  They have almost every kind of burger (even something for vegetarians and vegans)  I've never had something that I haven't liked from here.  The atmosphere is great, the servers are wonderful, and they have the best cheese curds ever!  However, on game days they are extremely busy and will encourage you to leave as soon as you are done with your meal.

Well, at the risk of sounding average, I'm rating this place the average of all 375 reviews. I really enjoyed my meal. Greeted immediately when I walked in, and seated right away. Server very nice and attentive. Onion rings good, not great (I prefer very light breeding). Fries decent. Burger was terrific. Cooked just like menu described. Good micro-brew list on tap. I wouldn't hesitate to return when in Madison, or suggest to anyone.

This place is legit!  The burgers are fresh and perfectly grilled.  Add the cheese curds and a selection of their local beer you can't go wrong!   Kayla is a great bartender too! Defiantly a place you should check out if you're looking for a place to grab some dinner.  The staff was awesome and the food matched! I'll be back!

The first time I went here, I didn't think it was anything special, but it really depends on the burger you buy.  I love the Melting Pot burger.  They also recently changed the menu so you can pick whatever toppings you want on the burger.  Burgers are cooked perfectly and are huge/filling.  Just know that the wait is really long whenever there's an event at the Kohl Center.

I had to check out a rumor which is why I chose this place.   Rumor was that this place had one of the best burgers in Winsconsin.  Being a burger affacionado, I had to put this claim to the test on my visit to Madison.  I will admit that the atmosphere is  a little weird.  Jazz standards and wooden booths say more steakhouse to me than burger joint.  Up until you see the menu, you almost feel underdressed in a T-Shirt and Jeans.

The food makes up for the confusion that goes on with the decor.   The cheese curds are a delightfully light and crisp.   The onion rings are thick and crisp and go nice with the slightly spicy sauce that accompaines them.  We even went so far as to try out a third side, the buffalo fries which is something so obvious of a  good idea that you wish you would have thought of it.  Of course you can put buffalo sauce on french fries.

The star of the show was the burger.   I went for the Melting Pot.  You can tell that tese people know what they're doing when it comes to burgers as the default cooking temperature for their burgers is a perfect medium.  This gives you a nice smoky char on the outside with a juicy interior.   The garlic sauce works with the three cheeses to create a perfect harmony.  Add in crispy bacon and you've got yourself a winner.

We went here after the Badger basketball game because of all of the good reviews on here and also because they were voted the 2nd best burgers in Madison, WE WERE NOT DISAPPOINTED!  Our party of 4 each ordered a different burger and a basket of fries and not one of us complained about the burger.  They were soooooooo messy and gooey and delicious!  We are fans and will be back for sure!

Great burger!  We travel all over and love burgers. We rate them on  a scale of 1-10.  This place is a solid 9.  Can't really think of a place we've been with a better tasting burger.  Darn near perfect burger.  Fries were okay. Great atmosphere love the collection.

Love the atmosphere. Cora was excellent behind the bar
Bison Burger could've been a bit thicker.

I was underwhelmed by my first Dotty's experience. I ordered the California burger and while the burger itself was juicy and tasty, the toppings that came on it were bland. The guacamole tasted and looked  like it had been made days earlier, and it had almost a sour taste. The cheese on the burger also wasn't melted, and the bun was so-so. Sweet potato fries were amazing, and I'm hoping that maybe I just got a bad burger, which I'm sure happens every once in a while. I will definitely be back though in hopes that it will live up to the hype that EVERYONE I know raves about!

Dotty Dumpling's has been getting better and better over the past few years. I didn't have a lot whole to complain about for my last review, and I have even less now. Dotty Dumplings' burgers are good stuff.

Their burgers are always flavorful, whether it's a Melting Pot, with their amazing English garlic sauce and three cheeses or a build-your-own, which my husband usually gets with cheddar and bacon. What I started to do on my last few visits was order a build-your-own with muenster cheese and then put into my burger cheese curds, onion rings, and English garlic sauce from the sampler basket. I love the combination of flavors and textures in their burgers: juicy beef patty; creamy cheese; garlicky bite of the sauce; crisp lettuce, tomato, and pickle; and a soft bun to absorb all of the juices and sauces. But you can get amazing textures and flavors from their signature burgers as well--if you want the cooks to do the burger assembling for you my favorite is the Boomerang, though I discovered the Toadstool on my last visit was crazy delicious. It's hard to beat the prices of their burgers for the quality that you get, too.

Dotty Dumpling's has been getting more and more kid friendly over the years, too. They added a kids menu 3-4 years ago and put their kids drinks in a plastic cup you can take home. On a few occasions when we've mentioned that our kids were splitting one kids meal they have split it for us and put their meals in separate baskets.

And let me say, I love the decor and feel of the place. My kids adore the model airplanes and I like the dark tavern-feel and the black and white movies--they provide a little entertainment but they aren't overstimulating like football games or even home improvement shows and don't take my attention away from my food nor my company.

Dotty Dumpling's continues to prove that they take pride in their burgers and in providing an excellent experience for their diners.

My first time here I wasn't blow away, but I was pleasantly content. After reading the reviews I was compelled to try it out. The atmosphere is like a dive bar with a touch of history, B&W programming on the TV, a plethora of beers on tap, and a selection of burgers that will make you scratch your head. 

I had the Grand Daddy burger with fries and it was cooked excellent and was actually a really big burger.  Basically coming out of the edges of the bun, slathered with gooey cheese and the garlic sauce added the perfect balance. The fries were good and there was an adequate quantity. 

Overall a good burger, not the best I have ever had, but maybe the 2nd best in Madison after Graze. Would like to try other burger options with a beer next I am there at night.

Amazing went here 2x in the span of two days. The staff was so nice and attentive, I'm big on customer service. The burgers are EVERYTHING, you can tell the beef is fresh, fun fact about this place is they have their own sauces and I tried one out and it was AMAZING. I also got the sampler under the appetizers, it included fried macaroni balls..... like what else do I need to say about those. they were next level. Really cute set up and you can tell it is a local favorite as it was packed when I arrived and the wait only got longer later into dinner time. I will definitely be back!

Finally went and was not disappointed.

The burgers are very good - juicy and flavorful. I got the one with all the different kinds of cheese (I forgot the name) and it was delicious. The cheese curds were also fantastic - gooey, not overly battered and up there with some of my faves.

The atmosphere was nice, kind of reminded me of Avenue Bar or something. Really nice waitress who knew we were in a rush and was very accommodating.

There are other interesting looking menu items but sadly I feel like it's sacrilegious to come and not get a burger, so I may never try one...

My buddies and I were passing thru Madison on our way to the Dells and a friend recommended this place so we decided to stop for lunch in this awesome college town. This place is so cool, nice vintage woodworks throughout gives its a turn of the century, Prohibition era vibe. They were even playing old black and white movies on the TV which I thought was so cool, then they started showing girls Wisconsin volleyball which was hot too LOL... anyways we ordered some beers from the awesome tap selection, my friend had one of the $10 cocktails, it was good but he thought it was too much $ it was worth a $7-8 dollars, maybe...  The food was amazing. We had the sample basket with fried mushrooms, onion rings, cheese curds, french fries and fried mac n cheese bites. Good fried stuff for sure. Get the English garlic mayo or the boomerang sauce, great stuff! We all had burgers, I had the Pub burger it was awesome with like an onion bacon jam and cheese and pickles... so delicious. Had it medium rare and it was just delicious. My buddies had the kobe burger, forgot the name but that was excellent too. That burger was like $12 mine was $8... totally on point with price. But you have to pay extra for sides which is dumb. I mean they make a killing at bar do you really have to charge for fries?? We also has the chili... mine with cheese melted on top and sprinkled with onions and sour cream... sooooo goood! It was the best chili I had in a long time. Its got tri-tip meat, oh my sooo gooood. A few of us thought it could have a little more kick'n heat to it but if you enjoy chili, you will walk away saying you loved it. I highly recommend it, especially during the cold winter months! Being from Chicago, there are no shortage of great places to eat but being out in Madison - this place is a must try!! Highly recommended and we will be back!!!

Solid place to grab a burger and a beer.  The cheese curds are awesome, lightly fried, fresh tasting, crunch on the outside, melty on the inside....mmmmm....you can easily share a small order of fries because they serve it in a massive basket.  Burgers are definitely messy, so it's certainly not a first date kind of place.  The beer selection is also pretty good.....try out the moose drool, which is far tastier than it sounds.  The ambiance isn't too bad either, with some interesting plane props, old classic movies on the mounted screens, and dimly lit, low hanging lights.  Solid.

This bar is in the heart of Madison's college campus and was extremely accommodating. As a vegetarian, I'm always leery on the flavor and value for veggie options at a bar, especially in the Midwest but Dotty didn't disappoint. We shared the local beer flights, Wisconsin cheese curds and a veggie burger (you can customize any of the burgers with a veggie patty) and it was delicious!! The service was so friendly and allowed us to mix and match our tastings to our preferences. The ambiance and decor of this place was cozy and perfect for families, dates or some solo game viewing. I'll definitely be back for my next cheese curd and spotted cow craving!

This is my favoritest place in Madison 2 get a burger....the choice of burgers they have is just awesome....and their chili cheese fries are just to die for.

The only flip side is the location.....i mean it's a great location...but that's just the problem! Parking can be hard to come by.....it's really close to the Kohl Center so if u r going there on a game-night...well, good luck getting a table...also, they have a limited menu on such nights...which sucks, given the great options they have on regular days.

But then the atmosphere is always great...game-night or not!

While walking around Madison and checking yelp for nearby spots, I found this place.  Its a great old school pub with old school wood and charm.  Since I was in Wisconsin i ordered the cheese curds to start, and then I got the California burger. I decided I'm not a fan of cheese curds. They are basically deep fried white cheddar balls. My burger was great and came with provolone cheese, smoked bacon, and avocado. There were lots of fun burgers on the menu and I had a hard time choosing what to get.

I'd recommend this place to anyone and stop by again my next time in Madison.

Probably my favorite place for burgers in Madison.  A bit pricier than most burger joints but the atmosphere is a little nicer considering it's still a downtown bar/burger joint.  

TVs are good for game day.  I love that they put malt vinegar at the tables.  My son loves their cheese curds.
Solid burgers and good cheese curds.  Better than expected.  Service was quick and friendly even though it was a busy night.

Don't question this burger joint, just drop in.

I spent a weekend in Madison hitting as many food spots possible and Dotty's was a fun stop. Just a cool little place with friendly service, great food, and excellent drinks. We had fried pickles and cheese curds for starters, I had the Heart Throb, a beer as well as a bloody mary with a beer back. Our waitress was really helpful in getting our bloodies the way we liked them and recommending good local brews.

I have high standards for burgers so if I rate this 4 stars and would return then it must be good.

Really good burgers. I had the Green and Gold. The bacon mayo on there was great. Hubby and I shared an order of cheese curds that were tasty. FYI, burgers do not come with fries except for the special. 

Good craft beer selection, some wines, and the cocktail menu looked good. Not a huge fan of frosty glasses for craft beer, but it wasn't so bad that there was an iceberg floating in my beer or anything. 

Atmosphere was great. Oldies playing. Singing in the Rain was on the TV. Cool decor. 

I would definitely stop in again.

Burgers were great - I had the basil & Mozarella with extra fried onions. The thing was greasy and tough to pick up but really tasty.

Atmosphere is great - a bit loud when sports are on. 

Beers: Oh my gosh - loads of beers from Europe and regionally on Tap.

Nice burgers! Good and sloppy the way it should be! A bit too dim for me, food's a tad expensive for sure, but I go back because it's still so good!

The service is always so nice, too, so I can't give this anything less than four stars! Please go on my behalf!

Back in the 90's I heard so many good things about this restaurant, but had yet to try it. On the back wall (by the restrooms) are a plethora of awards touting this joint as the 'Best Burger Place'. 

I came back to Madison for a visit this past weekend and made a stop to finally check out the hullabaloo.
It was around 2 p.m. and the hostess didn't even give us a 'hello' or any type of a greeting except "do you need a booster seat?"...not even eye contact.....and I gave her a kind 'hello' to begin with. Not like one of us didn't put for the effort.

Service was marginal. Not slow, but not quick either considering it wasn't that busy. Felt like we were interrupting. Like perhaps we were already after the lunch rush and what were we doing here?...It's time for the wait staff to rest of course. 
Asked for what I thought was a basic topping on a burger and got a chuckle out of the server "No, we don't serve THAT here'. 
Huh. okay. Glad I gave you a good laugh...but just an FYI Dotty, Great Dane does provide that topping. 

Had the minestrone soup, California burger and side of fries (you have to order fries separately.....they didn't come with the expensive burger). 

Soup was okay. Hearty and reasonably good flavor. Nothing special.
Burger was a HUGE disappointment. Flavorless and SMALL...looked like a kids burger. Unimpressive bun even.
Fries were basic. 
They actually charged us $.75 for a serving of ranch dressing! Everything was ala carte at this place I guess. Glad I didn't order extra napkins. I'd be broke!

As comparison, I recently had a Great Dane burger and let me tell you, now that is a GOOD burger!

Got a diet Sprite that needed 'changing'....waaay bitter. I realize that happens, but just was the icing on the cake of disappointment. 

I'd likely not return. Poor service, poorer burger.

Excellent burgers. While there are a number of specialty burgers available, the "build your burger" option seems like a good one to me. A wide variety of toppings are free of charge (standard lettuce, tomato, pickles, condiments, but also things that other places charge extra for - raw onions, grilled onions, a couple of kind of peppers), and another set of toppings is $0.75 each (bacon, blue cheese, guacamole, their sauces), which I thought was pretty good. Most importantly, though, the hamburger itself was great - a little crisp on the outside and pink in the middle (we asked for medium). The beer selection was pretty good and they were fairly quick with refills. Knocking down a star because the fries were fine but nothing special. A regular size was enough to share. We came a little after noon which was the height of the lunch crowd on a weekday but were seated after about ten minutes, which didn't seem too bad.

Oh how inconsistent you are. Great service and food one month. Then complete opposite the next. Its OK to have lower service standards, but at least keep the food as great as you have for these so many years.

Burger heaven on earth! I had wanted to try Dotty's for years and finally made it this visit to Madison. The atmosphere was eclectic, with an interesting collection of varied memorabilia. Although our server was great, I wish he knew a bit about the various items on the walls and ceiling, as I was curious. 

But I digress, as the star of the show at Dotty's is clearly the burgers, and justifiably so. My Heart Throb burger was awesome and the Black and Blue burgers others had were equally good. Comments on the fried cheese curds were "best ever". The French fries were fine, but nothing special. They have an awesome list of local and regional craft beers, as well as cocktails. 

Prices are surprisingly moderate for such high quality, but keep in mind that burgers are served solo; add-ons are a la carte. Having been to Dotty's only once before, way back in the beginning, I'm once again hooked.
Best burger in Madison. I honestly don't think anywhere else even compares. Keep doing what you guys are doing, aka making superb burgers.

I can tell you right now that their deep fried macaroni and cheese is battered heaven.  I highly recommend getting the sampler basket that has a whole cornucopia of deep fried tasties. (cheese curds, onion rings, mushrooms, mac and cheese, and fries) This place (obviously) is known for it's burgers so it doesn't really work well with my anti-red meat stance.  The veggie burger is okay and the salads are always crisp and fresh. My tuna steak sandwich was so so.  Also, do not go to Dotty's if time is a factor in your dining decisions.  Even during lunch Dotty's service is notoriously slow, day jobbers will never make it back to work in 45 minutes or less. (I suggest calling in your food ahead of time.) The reason why I do keep coming back here is that my dining companions love it, their beer selection is WONDERFUL, and I do not even know how to begin to deep fry my own macaroni and cheese.

I visited this place with my GF recently. I live in the DC/Baltimore region and we have our fair share of hamburger beer type places (brewer's art in Baltimore is amazing for example) but this place blew them all away.

Despite it being busy we got GREAT service, attentive waitress. The hamburgers were mind-blowingly good, extremely fairly priced and with 30 beers on tap the choices for what to wash it down with were endless.

Don't forget to order fried cheese curds!

Visited Dotty's for the first time yesterday. I had their Toadstool burger with a veggie patty and it was AMAZING. I always try to find local places when visiting other towns and I was not disappointed with this one! Our waitress (Paige) was extremely attentive and friendly. This is definitely a gem!
The best hamburger and cheese curds I have had. Had the melting pot burger and it was fantastic.

Today was my first visit here.  I have to say, the food is really good.  My friends ordered onion rings and they were delish!  EXACTLY how onion rings should be made!  I ordered the spicy black bean veggie burger and fries.  The veggie burger is a must to eat whether you are vegetarian or not.  Spicy but not too spicy.  The fries were good.  I ordered a side of ranch dressing and it was also exactly how ranch should taste.  Very fresh!

Any downsides?  The burger was messy.  Not just mine but 2 others at my table ordered the veggie burger and it was hard to handle and drippy.  One of my friends wound up asking for a fork to eat their sandwich.  And the service I found was a bit lacking.  I practically  had to send up flares to get a refill on my iced tea.    They weren't busy so she should have been more attentive.  

Will I be back?  Absolutely.  The food is good and so is the atmosphere.  I like the fact it is local and small in comparison to other restaurants.  I hate feeling like I am drowning in a sea of patrons.

What do I find a bit ironic about this place?  The name Dotty 'Dumpling's' Dowry.  There isn't anything related to a dumpling on the menu.  Maybe that is something the owner and/or head chef can think about in the future...

Mediocre day at what is probably a good place, a pub with a really good menu.

I started with the Chili.. when you say it's "award winning" that sets up some expectations.. so I got a bowl.. topped it with cheese and some sour cream.

Horrified, I almost ran from the place screaming.. they put MUSHROOMS in the chili! Who does that and why don't they warn you? I despise the funghi! It's not my fault, I've tried. They took away my almost full bowl, I moaned about the shrooms (got a shrug and a "sorry") and I paid for it anyway. Yuck.

We also shared some Mac and Cheese wedge's that were good.

OK.. let's move on... Madison is the State Capitol of Wisconsin...but we stopped there because it's a college town and we were on our way back from visiting family in Minnesota.  College towns have cool stuff and Madison is certainly pretty cool. It's Saturday and we aren't really thinking about it... but red shirts are everywhere... Oh yeah.. the University of Wisconsin Badgers! They have a home game so most people are at the game and not at Dotty Dumpling's Dowry (whew!) But they were losing 14-0 to the Minnesota Golden Gopher's.. the mood at Dotty Dumpling's Dowry decidedly displayed dismay. (Badgers went on to win later) 

I think the cook was definitely distracted, I know the server was.

"The burgers will be pink inside" Says it on the menu and she repeated it to each of us... They came well done. When I say well done; I don't mean that they did them well.. they was no hint of pink anywhere. That kind of sucks when you've got an $11 Grand Daddy Kobe beef burger or a $9 Buffalo Burger (Bison). So while the burgers had potential... they lacked in execution.

To complete the picture.. the burgers max out at 6 oz of meat and are served ala carte, so the pricing is really stiff for less than perfect. We all ordered fries and my son Ian got the Garlic Mayo for his fries (.75 upgrade)

I will say that the Heart Throb Sauce that I got on my burger was delicious!

No stars taken away because of the mushrooms.. there are obviously some misguided souls that think that's OK.

Dottys is excellent.
Fantastic service (frosted water glass) and delicious burgers. Id give it five stars if I had tried more items from the menu.
Warm ambiance.
Easy menu.
Just a good solid burger. I had the Gold and Green on a bed of lettuce and John had the pesto-y hot one. Both delicious! 
Try the bacon mayo. 
To note: every butger can be on lettuce for $1 more.
We will be back!
Very good burgers and cheese curds! Here for a weekend trip and absolutely loved this spot! The booths were very cozy. I would definitely recommend it.

I absolutely love this restaurant.  I've been there twice and it was great both times.  In fact, on my last visit we actually planned on eating at a different place down the road which I hear has a great burger.  We sat down, had a beer, and decided to head over to The Dowry to eat instead.

Great place with a great vibe. Food was just what I was looking for. If you have the chance to get Haris as your waiter you won't be disappointed! He helped me with choosing just what I was looking for and seemed happy to help! Definitely recommending to friends!

A la carte 6 oz. burgers for $8-12 in WISCONSIN should pack a punch. At Dotty's, it didn't. The "pink on inside unless otherwise requested" is a joke. I ordered med well black and blue burger and it came well done. Also, aside from the blue cheese, the burger itself was flavorless. The shakes and malts are $6, which I believe is expensive. The shake was mediocre, not memorable. I wanted I love this place but couldn't. I'm surprised this place is known for their burgers.
Burgers are good.  Service is very slow.  Two for Tuesday burgers are very small - its almost not a deal.  Eh.

We were in search for some good burgers and cheese curds ,  and we found it here.  From the hostess to the manager,  the customer service was outstanding. The manager not only checked on us,  but handwrote a list of the best places to get cheeses locally. My husband had 2 beers, and loved them both.  They also give you samples of their beer if  you want it before you order.  The kids all got free ice cream sandwiches after the meal. 

The burgers were good, but the toppings are what made them fantastic.  And the cheese curds? OMG.  Wonderful. Served with homemade ranch. 

One order of family size fries can easily feed 4-6 people. 

Must eat here!

Best burgers in Madison!  

Have been here several times and have absolutely loved it every single time.  The waitstaff is friendly, the environment is relaxed and they have a great beer selection with staff who are knowledgable about the beers.  

Even though they don't take reservations the wait is never too long, even on the weekends.  If you truly want to avoid waiting, anytime after 8:30 is probably safe to get you seated right away.

High recommendations for anything with the English garlic sauce, but especially the Melting Pot Burger (you might need a fork & knife to tackle this one).  Cheese curds are also wonderful.  Also if you're not loading up on drinks the meal is cheap! Went with a friend recently -we both got burgers and split the cheese curds and it came out to $10 a person!

Have to limit myself to only eating here once every month or two because it is completely against my diet.  However, when I do break the diet and eat at Dotty's it is definitely worth it!
Best burgers in Madison. Be sure to ask for lettuce, tomato, and onion otherwise it'll be plain (but still delicious)

Dotty's deserves all the hype that it receives. We enjoyed two of the best burgers you will ever find and equally delicious cheese curds - and this is coming from a guy who doesn't typically like curds.

The only cons I could ever offer are that the restaurant is small in size and in a prime location so the wait can be long (but worth it). Also, I love darker spaces when it comes to eating but I can see some finding it too dark.

If you haven't tried this gem, please do yourself a favor and do so soon.

Came here for lunch and the food was good! 
I had the Cajun Chicken Sandwich (hold the tomato please haha) and my fiance did the build a burger. Both of us were totally satisfied with the food and the service.The menu has so many options, it was hard deciding what I wanted!  I would love to come back for dinner some time because it's a pretty cool atmosphere.

Burgers are home cooked, ridiculous, beer choices are excellent,  not overly battered, awesome cheese curds.  Good background classic music, great staff.  Pure pleasure to visit.  In a downtown full of great choices, this is a laid back atmosphere standout that excels without trying hard.  

Big City
www.bigcityrocks
Sauces tasted great but burgers were burnt. Two in our party had stomach issues after eating there. Will never eat here again.
Nice rustic dark atmosphere, with good burgers and excellent chili. Prices are more than fair with adequate service.

Dotty's is the place I always go to when I'm craving a burger and I don't want to make it myself. I love Dotty's burgers, I love it they can make them exactly the way I would make it at home. The fries are outstanding and overall I just can't say enough about this burger. It truly is the best in the area.

Doty's is an excellent place for a burger and beer. This is not health food nor should it be! The burgers are the right ratio of fat to lean and cooked perfectly. The variety is amazing and I always find new things I want to try. 

The atmosphere is rich and Wisconsin with memorabilia from many WI cities. It can be hard to get a spot on the weekends but worth the wait. One of the best burgers in Madison without a doubt.
As always a great place for a burger. The food hasn't changed but the atmosphere isn't as good as their 2nd location.

Was passing through Madison when students were checking in for school and a young lady suggested this place for lunch. The burgers were fantastic. Tried cheese curds for the first time. The draft IPA was outstanding.  The waiter was terrific. But when I told one of the worlds foremost Sherlock Holmes scholars about this place and it's name, he couldn't find it. Don't know what that's about, but the food is fantastic!

Solid burgers, good sides, and good service. Our server had great recommendations on beer and burgers, and she wasn't wrong. There are tons of options, and I sampled a little of everything our party ordered. I'd recommend ordering a burger medium, as specified on the menu, as it wasn't super thick, so it was still nice and juicy without being raw-ish. 
The Southwest is great, as is the Heart Throb. The cheese curds were great, even though they were served with boring ranch sauce (get one of their signature sauces instead), and the fried mushrooms were decent too.
I understand the place can get pretty busy, but we went on the night after Christmas and the entire downtown was dead. Lucky for us. Party of 8 seated immediately.
Next time I will order one of their shakes too.
The ability to cook a perfect burger is Dotty's.  I'm so tired of places that over-cook.  My medium rare bison burger was the epitome of perfection.   I cannot wait for my next visit.

This place has a great homey, family bar feel and to be honest, it exceeded my expectation. They had an extensive beer list and I was happy to see they had Spotted Cow on draft as I don't get it often as I live in Illinois. I ordered the Heart Throb burger which had pepperjack cheese, smoked bacon and the special heart throb sauce. It was spicy but oh so delicious. I love that there are so many burger options with different flavor combinations. The cheese curds were great as well, although there could have been more.
Not really into all the fried food, but the OSO Nitro is delicious and the service is pleasant. Would definitely go back with friends.

Went on a Friday at 12:30 with some friends and sat at the bar which was completely empty besides a few employees at the far end. Seemed like service would have been good but that was obviously too much to hope for. Bartender was female blondish hair early 20s and super rude, acted like she didn't have time for us. The food is always wonderful but I can get the same thing elsewhere and get good service on top of that. I won't be back and neither will my friends. I don't look for an obnoxious attitude when I go out to eat. In fact I avoid it at all cost.

This place is awesome! Had the veggie burger, they hand make their patties and you can get the veggie patty on any original burger choice. I got the original veggie, but I'll definitely be going back to try their other options. The ranch was delicious, I dipped my fries. We also got another homemade honey mustard sauce with our cheese curds and that was delicious too! I saw a guy order an old fashioned down the bar from me and I thought that looks like a good old fashioned so of course I ordered one and I was not disappointed!! We were going to sit at a table, but because it was so busy we ended up getting seating  at the bar and sat there to eat instead and it was great! Will definitely go back! Cool atmosphere, definitely great wait staff and great WI bar and grill!

The burgers live up to the hype, they are juicy and oh so delicious. The garlic sauce they put on them is also excellent, not too garlicky, but enough to taste. The have a great list of micro brewed beers on tap too.

We went up to Madison to see The Avengers with our daughter. It was the weekend they block off Mifflin for a (wait for it.....) .... yes... a BIG DRINKING PARTY! While it was fun to watch all the yunggins having a drunk-n-blast, it was nice to find a respite by dashing in to Dotty's for some quiet time, delicious burgers, and a beer.

Four of us got burgers... yum! The fifth, my daughter, is a veggie. She got a salad. Clearly she was not as excited as the rest of us. Her salad looked good, but typical. The burgers, on the other hand, are wonderful. You can pick from several toppings. All were sufficiently messy and dripped down our faces. They serve them in baskets which really doesn't work for a messy burger. 

They have a good beer selection (it is Madison, after all) and the staff was friendly. Maybe they just came from Mifflin?

Service was great, food was delicious. Their mac and cheese bites were to die for! I wasn't a fan of the fried mushrooms but they weren't bad. Their burger was well cooked, juicy and flavorful. I had the sampler as an appetizer and it is A LOT of food! Definitely more food that's ACTUALLY shareable unlike a lot of places that give you like 4 pieces of it. Definitely will be going back in the future!

Never had a bad experience at Dotty's.  Game day it can be tough to get seated but so is any other restaurant near the Kohl Center.  I usually go for one of their many tasty burgers.  I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.

Awesome burger place in downtown Madison. I had the Grand Daddy burger with house made English sauce. Very good and tasty burger made to perfection. Atmosphere was very crowded but it wasn't a problem for us. Kid friendly as well

Best Burger in Madison.

When I'm in the mood for a real burger this is where I come. A basket do fries and one of their speciality burgers and I'm in food comatose.

If you're in downtown Madison and are going g to eat Bar food come here.

Just ate here for lunch and came away impressed. Had the Melting Pot burger which was cooked perfectly medium pink and was delicious.

We had cheese curds too which were also delicious but could have included a couple more curds for the price. 

I think the best thing about this place besides the delicious burger was the atmosphere. They keep the lights down and have a dim light at every table. They played great music on the speakers which included Michael Buble, Frank Sinatra, and other jazz music. Definitely felt cozy, especially on a cold day. I will be back here for sure.

Sat at the bar, so can't really speak for service. Amazed how busy this place was at 6:30 on a Monday night, but there was a constant stream of people. Enjoyed the wedge salad and would happily eat it again. Would choose a less busy time next time...whenever that is.
Sat at the bar to work and spend some free time on a weekday evening. The reason for the 5 stars is twofold: the cheese curds and the $2.50 Spotted Cow. That's all a Sconnie girl needs.

No news here, just a repeat of what everyone else has said.  On our way to Minneapolis for the 4th of July weekend, we noticed our route was putting us through Madison, WI.  The timing was perfect for dinner so we got off the highway and headed to downtown Madison.  Ashley found Dotty's (on Yelp of course!) and read me the reviews of other fellow Yelpers.  

Good burgers, huh?  We'll see about that.  Walking into Dotty's was like walking into a neighborhood bar.  UW sports memorabilia everywhere (which I didn't care for as I am a Hoosier alum), and friendly faces waiting to serve you.  

I had a tasty local beer and we ordered cheese curds for an appetizer.  Best curds I've ever had, and my wife said the same thing.  She is from WI so her opinion is worth more than mine!

The burger was legitimately one of the best I have ever eaten.  Chicago Yelpers: it reminded me of a Portillo's burger, but bigger and with higher quality beef.  So delicious.  I didn't want it to end...luckily, Ashley couldn't finish hers and I got a couple extra bites :)

The kids meal for our little one was good too.  It came with chicken fingers, fries, a Go-gurt, and a drink.  I wish there was a Dotty's closer to home, but if I'm ever in Madison again to watch IU kick UW's butt, I'll be sure to stop in for that ridiculously good burger again!
Super amazing burgers. Lots of different specialty types. Sweet potato fries were amazing. The place was a little dark and had small tables but overall this is a great place to go if you love burgers

This place can get busy. Especially before a game at the Kohl Center. Finally had a chance to visit Dotty's this past year on multiple occasions. We liked it that much to come back a few times.

Instead of coming before a game, we've tried to go right after or when it's not at busy. Great burger selection and you can share a side like a basket of fries. Definitely a place worth checking out if you like burgers.

This was one of our college hangouts when it was located on Regent Street, yeah, that was a long time ago.  We stopped for an early lunch while biking around town.

The great selection of burgers is a plus - I got the one with the english garlic sauce which was very good and it was perfectly medium rare.  I spotted the chili on the menu and remembered it was one of my favorite - I ordered a cup and the memories rushed back.  It was very good.

Our waitress was very friendly.  Will make sure to eat here again when we visit town next summer.

I just returned to Dotty's after a 15 year hiatus, and I'm happy to report that their burgers are still delicious as hell.

Great interior, great beer selection, and deliciously juicy burgers.  (My wife said hers was "too juicy."  i think I may have to trade her in.)
I love their burgers when you ask for them to be cooked medium well. Everything is home cooked. Great craft beer selection and a really nice down-to-earth feeling inside. Highly recommend this place.

One of Mad Town's oldest establishments, this is a go to before any Badger game at the Kohl Center.  Famous for their burgers, this dimly lit environment is full of warmth and great decor.  I really love all the fun stuff and Badger memorabilia they have on the walls.  

The bloody I had was delicious, check it out on instagram; #bloody_mad

Good atmosphere, friendly staff. Food and service were average. Not a place I would want to visit over and over again. We had heard so much about the place we were really excited to finally get there but it was nothing memorable. Just your regular run-of-the-mill Madison pub stuff.
This place is a MUST whenever I visit Madison. The burgers are amazing and I always get an order of cheese curds. I always rave to anyone I know about how much I love their food!
