25 micro brews on tap and the best burger I have ever had!  This is a must visit for anyone in Madison WI. Gotta luv college towns!

"Best burger in Madison:

HMMMMMMMMMMM

It was PACKED and crazy....but that was right AFTER we got seated! Make sure to come early if it's game day so you can get a seat. ;)

We have eaten enough in Madison to know that there are a few hidden gems that deserve to be recognized nationally. That being said when we heard that DDD's was voted the best like 100 years in a row we had to check it out. 

We ordered a burger each, jambalaya "soup" as an appetizer and a regular order of chili fries. 
First of all WOW the regular order of chili fries was humongous. That was really unexpected. It was also unexpected that it took so long to order and it  arrived ridiculously late. 
Secondly I had ordered the California burger and which was supposed to come with a whole bunch of toppings that sounded amazing on the menu but when I got it I literally had to remove the top bun to make sure that I got the right burger because I didn't taste half the toppings. 

I have been to "gourmet" burgers joints before and have loved every second of them. I however did not find justification in spending $8+ for a sliver of a burger with very dismal amount of toppings. (was that burger patty even 4 ounces??)

When it's dinner time in Madison, your options are endless. My brother mentioned this place so we thought we would give it a try! Almost everything on their menu is made in house, including sauces and pickles.

Atmosphere:
The restaurant is very small with not much seating. It creates a very cozy, lively atmosphere but also not a great place for groups bigger than 4.

Food: 
We split an order of cheese curds, sweet potato fries, and regular fries.  The cheese curds were what you expect in Wisconsin. Gooey cheese and lightly battered. The French fries we average.  They didn't have much flavor to them. The sweet potato fries were my favorite. They were very crunchy and lightly fries. For the entree I split the wedge salad and the gambler burger with my dad. We paid extra for bacon on a wedge - which typically comes with bacon, and they were only a few crumbs. It was disappointing. Our gambler burger was tiny. The meat to bun ratio was basically only bun. The patty was the size of a culvers patty. Again our burger said it was "loaded with bacon" and there was only one strip. The burger didn't have much flavor and was very pricy given its size and the fact that it doesn't come with a side.

For dessert my brother had a vanilla malt. They use an old fashioned malt mixer when they make their malts. It was very good!

Burgers Galore! Disclaimer: there are no dumplings here, but that's alright! They are the number one burger place for many reasons. My personal favorites are the Melting Pot and the Bayou. These perfectly pair with their deep fried cheese curds and their garlic ranch. If you're feeling adventurous, the Bison burger is the way to go! Awesome service, but if you're the impatient kind, give the Poutine a try while waiting. Pro tip: pair your burgers with a Wisco beer!
Pretty disappointing Friday Fish Fry. Walleye was attractive and the fish itself satisfying but the breading was soggy and not particularly flavorful. Very good beer selection.

Best lamb burger ever, and definitely the best burger place in Madison. The cheese curds are amazing as well. Only two complains are that the restaurant is very dark and loud, and the drinks are a little overpriced. Still, I go there all the time because of the amazing food.

The host or the maybe she was the manager. When I walked in ask for table for 3. They were about to seat us on a high table. Then my mom walked behind me with her wallker and the manager came by talked to me asked me if I wont mind sitting in this half booth table. Which would work out better for my mom. There was a server that almost ran into my mom couple times. The manager or the host with the wonderful star wars shelve tattoo came by once my mom was seated. She asked if this table was better. We told her it was better. Then we told her about the waiter that almost ran into mom. She felt bad and she said she would talk to him and she offered free piece of pie. Thanks to the wonderful host or manager she help bring back loving this place. 
We order deep fried cheese curds. They were still squeaky. We also order Kobe beef upgrade. It was awesome suggestion to do. We are truly coming back this place. It was worth the trip to have a wonderful burger.

We went here for dinner during the Kentucky Derby. We've tried to go a few times only to be greeted by a 2 hour wait, so this time we went around 4pm.

The service is why you're losing 2 of the stars. First thing that was a red flag: I ordered a mint julep (in true Derby fashion), and the waitress said they couldn't make it unless I told them the ingredients. Really? A mint julep? I assured her that the bartender would know how to make a mint julep, but she was pretty curt, so I opted for a draft beer instead. Additionally, we only saw her every 10 minutes and couldn't find her when we needed something. Pretty poor overall.

The food and drinks were pretty good, but nothing like the other reviews claim. I got the spicy veggie burger (which WAS pretty spicy) and that was tasty. The fries were alright.

Dotty, you can do better. :-/

I went to Madison last week and after reading good reviews on Yelp decided to stop at Dotty's for a burger. I ordered the Melting Pot and my boyfriend got the Heart Throb. Both burgers were absolutely delicious! The heart throb was spicy, but tolerable. And the melting pot was awesomely cheesey with a mayo-garlic sauce. I hate mayo, but this sauce was the boss. We also got cheese curds because of all the reviews about them on yelp, so yummy! The server was very sweet and the place had a great vibe.Overall  I loved it!
I will definitely go here again the next time I find myself in Madtown.
The burgers are great and cooked perfect. Good curds, average fries and wide beer selection. Chocolate milkshake was good, too. Must visit if you're in the area.

Hands down the best burger in Madison. The food is complex yet simple. They start with a great base which is high quality meat. Then they get creative and add amazing flavor combinations to their burgers. There is nothing better than a burger from Dotty's on a game day, or on any other day of the week. The atmosphere is wonderful and you can't help but get into the Madison experience while eating there.

Came here in my search for the best fried cheese curds in Madison.  They did not disappoint, but weren't in my top thee places for cheese curds.  

The burgers were solid, though.  I'm dreaming about them at night.  

The service was good.  The decor was pleasant.  All in all, I will go back...but not with any urgency.

We chose the Aphrodite special and Rolls Royce burger. Blue Moon Belgium White Ale is delicious and Fat tire. Food was good. Service good. Ambiance here is always upbeat. Service is friendly and it's not too long to wait for the food. Usually busy here on game day!

Simply some of the best burgers around. I have tried a number of the burgers on the menu, and they are always cooked as ordered and topped with all sorts of interesting toppings. You can always customize a burger with the various standard toppings (and the not-so-standard - garlic sauce? Yum!) or order one of the named concoctions right off the menu. The onion rings are better than average and don't usually fall apart on you (my pet peeve).

The staff is friendly, and the service prompt and relatively quick. You might have to wait a bit for a table and a slight bit for your food if the place is packed. That will happen before or after a Wisconsin Hockey or Basketball game or any other event held at the Kohl Center. Some friends and I always stop here before going to the State Basketball Championships, and we are usually glad we did.

Had a really good time at this place. The atmosphere was really cozy and inviting. The food was good but our server Haris was the best part! He was really attentive, always offering to move something out of our way or to get us another beer. His cheerful personality was really nice. He even gave us some good recommendations that worked out perfectly for both of us. 

Don't let these slightly unappetizing-looking burger fool you. This is a really nice spot!

My boyfriend and I love it here; it's one of our go-to date places! 

The first time we went, we both got "Build Your Own Hamburgers," and shared sides of French fries and fried mushrooms. The burgers are pretty big, but really good, so it makes sense that it's what they're famous for. The sides were good, but it's worth noting that they aren't served with your burger or sandwich so you have to order them separately.

The second time I went I was with a couple girlfriends and I ordered the grilled cheese with deep fried pickles. In theory, the idea of that sounded amazing, but they also added a thick layer of some kind of tarter sauce which I wasn't expecting and wasn't a fan of. (Nothing against their tarter sauce, I just don't like it in general.) Luckily, I had also ordered a chocolate malt which was so incredible and totally saved the experience!

The third visit and all subsequent visits have been with my boyfriend. It was during the third visit that I tried the Deep Fried Cod Sandwich, and I have never turned back. It's so simple, but so delicious: just a piece of fried cod with lettuce and tomato on a light, fluffy bun. (I think it also comes with tarter sauce, but I ask them to leave that off.) My boyfriend continues to build his own burgers and we order a variety of sides to share, but usually the fries or cheese curds. (Or both!) And I usually try to find a way to justify getting their chocolate malt because it's just so amazing! I don't think I've had a better one anywhere else!

Dote [doht]  
verb (used without object), dot*ed, dot*ing. Also, doat.
to bestow or express excessive love or fondness habitually (usually followed by on or upon): They dote on their youngest daughter. - thank you: http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/dote?s=t 

Yes. I dote on Dotty's. More specifically, I dote on the goodness that is Dotty's Melting Pot burger.

Maybe it's the trifecta of cheddar, swiss, and provolone cheese that I am infatuated with. 

Maybe it's the hefty slices of Jones Dairy Farm smoked bacon that I love.

But if I really must confess, I know that deep down, it's the signature, incredibly flavorful, English garlic sauce that I am unable to erase from my memory. The level of delicious already present in this great burger increases five-fold thanks to the mighty powers of this wonderful sauce. 

The burger is messy, but reasonably so. You'll be willing to get your hands (and face, and clothing) dirty in order to experience this #1 selling burger love.

YUM! My fiance and I stopped in Sunday afternoon to split a burger; we weren't that hungry, but wanted to try this place we had heard great things about before leaving Madison. We tried the #1 selling burger, The Melting Pot (3 cheeses with smoked bacon and garlic aioli) with fries and were not disappointed! The chef even cut our burger in half and sent it out in 2 baskets for us, what service! The burger was cooked a perfect medium and juicy - we loved it. I also enjoyed the malt vinegar at the table to add to my fries. Quick and friendly service, very affordable, and a playlist of mostly Beatles and Bowie, so it gets my seal of approval. We will definitely be back to try the Green and Gold burger next time we visit Madison.
Always a good atmosphere and especially good burgers at decent prices. Ask for their specials! The prices are decent too - typical of downtown Madison.

I won't ever get over the move from the old location, which I loved, but the new place is centrally located. I love Dotty's juicy burgers, and the numerous variations are really creative (my personal favorite is the Ceasar). My guy thinks they're too small. (He may have a point, but he could just get 2 of them). Anyway, they are grilled, not flame broiled, and are 6 oz, and I think that's pre-cooking (a warning in case like my guy you think all burgers should be in the 8+ oz range). The bun in unusual and not a traditional burger bun - it's that yellowish bread you sometimes see that can get a little soggy under the meat juices and sauces. 

The sides are great - I love any place with fried shrooms, and they have some of the best cheese curds I've had in Wisconsin - crisp, not at all greasy, and I think there's a touch of cornmeal in the batter. Fries are also good. I also appreciate a place that has malt vinegar on the tables, 'cause some of us really like that tang with our fried stuff. My kids LOVE the shakes, and they are really luscious. Waitstaff is always efficient, and even on the weekends, the wait for a table isn't forever. So it still is a favorite of mine - I just go without the boyfriend.

Big fan of this place.  I like the burger selections and they also have make your own as well.  Lamb burger is delicious as well.  The fries are fantastic and so are the fried mac & cheese bites.  Beer selection is solid.  If you want a burger in Madison, this is the place to go.  They cook all their burgers medium unless you tell them otherwise or a waitress asks.

This is a great place for no frills, just honest and SCRUMPTIOUS burgers! 
It's a dive in the true sense of the word (this should be on diners, drive-ins and dives!)

Super affordable (most burgers are under $9)

Great flavor profile (from traditional, to make your own and their premade combos- all are amazing! I had the hearthob- nice and spicy! Hubby had the English toadstool). they have really great sauces to accompany your burger and things to dip

Sides are all amazing and worth trying (onion rings are perfectly crunchy and panko crusted and their fries are prefectly crisp and skinny)

options for vegetarians and vegans (yay!)

This is a must do when in Madison (especially on a game day!)

I think the only thing I wasn't crazy about was the dessert- only one thing the homemade fudge bottom pie (I say skip it and go elsewhere) It's 75% whipped cream (unless you like whipped cream that much!)

Definitely would come back! This is great to go with other people and share a bunch of the sides

Service was great!
Juicy burgers with a variety of different toppings. Impressive list of sauces for dipping their delicious French fries. My favorite burger joint in Madison!

Busy place but still got a table relatively quickly, friendly service.  Tried the cheese curds since it is a Wisconsin specialty, super good with ranch sauce.  They are similar in concept to mozzarella sticks, except smaller, different batter, and cheese.  Had a customized burger (recommend skipping the cheese after having the curds) as well with their English garlic sauce, excellent.

Ideal lunch at Dotty's in downtown Madison: Spotted Cow with fried cheese curds (only in Wisconsin!) followed by English Garlic sauce burger with chili cheese fries.  After that, you might as well go home because you're certainly not getting anything done at the office anymore. Pretty good burgers (buns are too small), great tap beer selection, and fantastic chili cheese fries.

In a sea of red UW Madison t-shirt clad women servers DDD is as busy as can be and packed to the gills on a weekend night in Madison. Perfect mix of parents, visiting protesters, kids, and UW students. I have not been to Madison since I attended UW and all the giant tower private dorms crowd out the buildings near DDD so the neighborhood seems so odd these days. What's with these fancy "private dorms" .... really parents? Are you all totally nuts? What every happened to roughing it when in college? Rant rant. :) OK, my review.... 

So, Thank goodness this Madison institution still sells an amazing burger. I had the Heart Throb and my friend had the blue ribbon and what we got were two amazing burgers brought out quickly. The burgers were medium as we requested and the flavor and fries were perfect. All around an amazing burger, fun servers who were in a good mood and seemed to like to joke around with a couple of old geezers. There are some things that could be improved upon. 

Why not go a little more upscale and offer brie and blue cheese for a little more money? Also, I agree with Katy B that a fried egg on top option is now a must for a good burger place. Just a few tweaks and this place would be 5 stars in my book.

Any time we end up here, it's a result of desultoriness. Don't get me wrong, there is nothing wrong with this place. They have a great selection of burgers and other sandwiches, as well as fried offerings. It's just that somehow, we only go here when we don't know what else we should do. Had two beers on the Terrace? Getting out of a hockey game late? You're tired after a long day at school? Go to Dotty's! For all of these situations, this joint serves wonderfully. They could make it a bit brighter, though, I often feel like I'm about to pass out when I'm there!
I got the Heart Throb burger with fries and cup of chili.  The chili wasn't my favorite, but wasn't that bad.  The burger was really good.  Cooked to medium with some pink the flavor was great.
Great atmosphere, great beer, and our waitress was cute..what more can you ask for??
